loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Yryskan's Group

texts.en:
Yryskan S. is the leader of the group. She is a 60 year old widow. She has 2 sons: the eldest is engaged in trade in Bishkek, the youngest one is a farmer. The family enriches their budget by cattle breeding and selling dairy products. During the years of working they have managed to build a two-room house. The loan purpose is to purchase a color TV-set. In the future Yryskan is planning to increase her cattle stock.

Ainura A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and married. Her husband is currently working in Russia. Temporarily she has to take care of 4 children by herself, the elder are schoolboys, the youngest daughter goes to kindergarten. The family makes their living by cattle breeding. They have a milking cow and 2 heifers. Out of their profits they have managed to make house repairs. In order to purchase a lot for further house building, Ainura hopes to get a loan. In the future she intends to install gates and a fence and then to give university education to the children. 

Kyzdarhan T., 47, is married. Her husband raises money by repairing highways. The couple has 3 children: the eldest son works in Russia, the rest are school students. Since 1995, the family has been engaged in cattle breeding. They had started from fattening 9 sheep and a cow and now they have 2 cows with a calf and 4 sheep. This business made it possible to obtain a TV-set. In order to plow up land, the family needs to get a loan. In the future Kyzdarhan is planning to arrange her son’s wedding, to give her children an education and to build a house.

Uulhan JusumA., 60, is married. Her husband is a pensioner. The couple has 4 children: the daughters are married, the sons are farmers. The main family source of incoming is cotton cultivating. Out of the business profits they have managed to increase their cattle stock. Uulhan hopes to get a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds. In the future she is planning to build a summer kitchen and to buy furniture.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a TV.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has 4 children aged 15, 10, 8 and 4 years. In 2001, Aminata established her provisions such as milk, sugar, margarine, sardine etc. and bottled drinks business. She began her own business after gaining enough experience from her elder sister. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 380,000 SLL every month from this business. Aminata has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, sugar, milk, margarine, sardine and oval tine for her business. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children and help to provide livelihood for them. In the future, Aminata plans to build a house for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, sugar, milk, margarine, sardine and oval tine.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y detergentes al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria, 34, is divorced and has four children.  She is a member of the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO” communal bank located in Corao district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store.  She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar and milk.  She works from 6am until 10pm and is able to support her children through this small business.  She’d like to enlarge and improve the grocery store and is asking for funds to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergents at wholesale.

She thanks all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergents at wholesale.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir A. keeps two cows and this is the only financial source for this family. He has been running his business since 2008 and sells milk products to the local milk farm, and there is also a high demand for this product among the local people. Samir is married and has two sons. He usually buys small calves for a good price, fattens, and then sells them at the Livestock Bazaar in Imishli city (1 hour away from his home city) once every 6 months.  Now he has applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two more cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father.  

Halima has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 4 years and she works 7 days of every week. Halima sells her products in a retail shop. Halima has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more cream hair relaxers, weaves and braids. The main business challenges for Halima include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon and also to build her own house. Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes C. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 19 years old. Jovelyn is married and has two small children. To make a living, Maria Lourdes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned good, and snack foods. Maria Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits and snack foods. This loan will be the first loan Maria Lourdes has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods

loans.name: Taulupe

texts.en:
Taulupe T. is a 40 year old woman living in the town of Lalomalava.  She is married and has six adult children.  To make a living, Taulupe owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Taulupe has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 370 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Taulupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan from SPBD of 2000 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  This will be her third loan from SPBD.  Taulupe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La señora Eva E. R. vive en la comunidad de Aserradero a 10 minutos del municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca, ella tiene la edad de 37 años y es madre soltera de un niño de nombre Diego de 15 años de  edad que asiste a la escuela secundaria de Acatlan. Doña Eva nos platica que ella inicio trabajando fuera de casa de dependienta pero un día inicio a vender ropa interior por catalogo y se dio cuenta de que ganaba mas y tenia mas tiempo para estar a lado de su hijo y educarlo, ella tiene ya mas de 2 años vendiendo ropa interior, nos comenta que ella vende casa por casa, lleva los catálogos a sus clientes, levanta pedido lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando le llega el pedido lo entrega  y recibe el pago por sus productos, ella vende en su comunidad y también sale a otros pueblos como Cosolapa, Tezonapa, Refugio y Motzorongo. Ella nos dice que decidió iniciar  a trabajar ya que es madre soltera y tenia que vestir, calzar y alimentar a su hijo,  doña Eva también tiene un pequeño corral en la parte de atrás de su casa en donde tiene unos borregos los cuales cría y después vende, ella necesita este crédito  para invertirlo en la compra de catálogos, ropa interior y alimento para sus borregos. Doña Eva espera que con este préstamo su negocio prospere y con sus ganancias poder vender sabanas y colchas. ella quiere seguir trabajando ya que quiere que su hijo en un futuro tenga una profesión.
Doña eva se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le esta dando con este préstamo de que su negocio prospere y por la confianza que le a brindado al otorgarle este  préstamo.
texts.en:
Ms. Eva E. R. lives in the community of Aserradero, which is 10 minutes away from the city of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca. She is 37 years old and is a single mother with one son named Diego, who is 15 years old. He goes to high school in Acatlan. Eva says that she started working outside the home as a shop assistant, but one day she began to sell underclothes by catalog. She realized that she was making more money and had more time to be with her son and to educate him. She has already been selling underclothes for more than two years. She goes door to door selling clothes, bringing the catalogs to her customers. She brings the orders to her suppliers and later when the orders arrive, she delivers them to her customers and receives the payments for her products. She sells in her community and also goes to other towns such as Cosolapa, Tezonapa, Refugio and Motzorongo. She decided to start working because she is a single mother and she has to feed and clothe her son.

Ms. Eva also has a small corral behind her house where she keeps lambs that she raises and later sells. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs, underclothes and because she wants to continue working so that her son can be an educated professional in the future. Eva is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that it has given her, so that her business can prosper and also for the trust they have shown in her by granting her this loan.

loans.use: The sale of catalog clothing and raising lambs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty E. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Betty owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Betty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Betty from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Batsoy, who is 55 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 16 and 35 years old. Sarma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sarma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000 to buy additional stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Sarma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the resident of Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. Her home is located in the area of Abdullah basti and it contains 3 rooms made up of bricks. She moved here after her marriage with M. A. about 24 years ago. 
She is a 40 year-old housewife, stays at her home does household responsibilities. She is very active and completes her household tasks in a very efficient manner. 

Her husband operates an auto repairing workshop where he can repair from motorbikes to cars. He is known as an expert in his work and has a good number of clients in his area. 

Nasreen has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son is 22 years old and works with his father in his workshop. The second son is a rickshaw driver and her elder daughter operates a clothes sewing business. Her remaining two children are enrolled in a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy auto repair tools to offer better quality services to his clients. 

Her husband started this business 5 years ago and Nasreen is confident that the loan will help him further improve his business, which will result in better financial life for her family. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and has always paid her installments on time. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen”.

loans.use: to buy tools for auto-repair workshop

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe C. is from the village of Pianon, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Bernabe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernabe owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general services to local community members. Bernabe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bernabe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernabe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bernabe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del banco comunal “Unidas siempre unidas”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Ella se dedica a vender comida rápida especialmente sopaipillas, completos y papas fritas. Patricia vende sus productos en lugares establecidos como colegios y empresas de construcción, ya que es en estos sitios donde se sitúa la gran cantidad de sus clientes, que son estudiantes y trabajadores. Para conservar sus productos en buen estado utiliza un cooler. Patricia tiene muchos clientes y muy diversos. Además ella se dedica  a la venta de utensilios de aseo por lo que los horarios lo flexibiliza Patricia. 
Con el préstamo comprará un carrito que contiene en su interior un fogón o cocinilla, además invertirá en insumos para su otro negocio que es la venta de artículos de aseo.
Su sueño es trabajar desde su casa e instalar su propio local comercial, donde pueda ofrecer con mayor facilidad sus productos. 
Patricia vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, uno de ellos estudiará una carrera técnica relacionada con la construcción. Es por esto su motivación de continuar en el negocio, es poder generar mayores ganancias para costear los estudios superiores de su hijo.
Patricia está muy contenta del préstamo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un apoyo fundamental para su negocio, respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido a registrar sus gastos e ingresos.  
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the "Unidas Siempre Unidas" (United Always United) community bank which is located in the city of Concepción.

Patricia's business is selling fast food, especially sopaipillas (a type of fried pastry), completos (sandwiches) and fries.  She sells her products in places such as schools and construction companies since this is where a lot of her customers, who are students and workers, are located.  She uses a cooler to keep her products fresh.  Patricia has a wide range of customers.  In addition to this business, she also sells personal care products and she works her hours around both businesses.

Patricia will use this loan to buy a small cart with a burner or stove inside.  She will also invest in buying supplies for her business selling personal care products.

Patricia's dream is to work from home and set up her own business premises where she can sell her products more easily.

Patricia lives with her husband and her two children.  One of her children is going to take a vocational course in the construction field.  This gives her motivation to continue in her business as she would like to make more profits so that she can cover her son's higher education expenses.

Patricia is very happy with the loan from Fondo Esperanza since it has been a fundamental support for her business.  Through the training sessions, she has learned to keep a record of all her incomings and outgoings.

Concepción is located on the mouth of the River Bíobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country.  The city is in the south of Chile, in Bíobío region.  It has played an important part in our country's history as it was the scene of some important battles and notable settlement, especially during the Araucho War as it was on the border with Mapuche territory.  The city is currently experiencing a high level of financial and demographic development and is starting to be considered one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, economic and demographic centers in Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy a small cart that has a burner or stove inside

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 33-year-old farmer who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She tills her land and prepares it well for cropping. She grows rice and sells her harvest to the market. Annie is planning to grow pigs in her backyard. She says the extra income will really help her family.

Annie's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, piglets and feed. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and three young children who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She has worked in different tailoring factories for more than 20 years. In 1995, she started running her own business from her house. She is an experienced tailor, paying attention to every detail. She is very kind and knows how to deal with people. She helps her husband in paying the household expenses and especially the children’s education fees. She has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with prompt payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new, advanced tailoring machinery in order to improve her business. In the future, she expects to earn high profits to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase new advanced tailoring machinery.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos a la señora Julia de 37 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Julia tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde cosecha y siembre dependiendo a la época diferentes productos como por ejemplo lechuga, asnapa, ruda, perejil, maíz, papa y otras cosas más. Ella en el interior de su casa tiene una granja donde se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas. 

El crédito que ha solicitado Julia es de 1,500 nuevos soles a la Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Julia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a place known as Arin community which is noted for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

In Arin community we meet 37 year-old Julia who lives with her partner and has four children.  She lives in her own home which has water and electricity.  It is located in Calca province, in Cusco department.  The main business activities in this area are farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Julia has several plots of land where she grows and harvests different produce such as lettuce, asnapa (a herb), rue, parsley, corn, potatoes, etc., according to the season.  at home she has a farm where she raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  Her parents taught her this work from a very early age and now she has her own farmland where she works together with her partner.  They grow their vegetables with a lot of care.

Julia has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Asociación Arariwa which she will use to buy more animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  Julia is a hard-working woman who has always known how to get ahead, improve herself and get what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Yudith Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a  diferentes instituciones y al publico en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, polos y chompas.
                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras" community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

The borrower is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  She sells pants, blouses, sweaters and tops.  She makes her sales independently and sells to different institutions and to the general public.  The borrower would like to expand her clothes business.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, tops and sweaters.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, tops and sweaters

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 47-year-old married man with 24 children who lives in his own house with four bedrooms and two living rooms in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a peasant and also a cattle trader, who has spent 30 years in this business. He was initially a coffee farmer and after accumulating savings he started to trade cattle. His major challenge is limited funds to meet the demand of his customers. His dream is to own a ranch. Richard needs money to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida de 31 años de edad, enviudo muy joven, pero tiene 2 hijos, pedro de 11 años, y jazmín de 2 añitos de edad, juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Zenaida, es una mujer trabajadora, desde muy pequeña aprendió a labrar la tierra. Cuando decidió formalizar su familia, emigraron a esta parte de la selva peruana exactamente al centro poblado de Canayre, que con el poco recurso que tenían adquirieron una parcela de cacao donde hoy cuenta con un parque recreacional, con piscina y juegos infantiles, generándoles un ingreso económico para el bienestar de su familia. Hace un año atrás perdió a su querido esposo a causa de una enfermedad y desde ese momento zenaida tuvo que hacerse cargo de todos los trabajos que tenía su esposo. Zenaida no se deja vencer, es  más esta animada en continuar el trabajo que su esposo realizaba y si es posible mejorar su parque recreacional. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que esta comprometida en realizar el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente. Zenaida es una mujer bien comprometida con los quehaceres de su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles,  invertirá en el remodelamiento de su campo recreacional campestre.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 31 years old and became a widow at a young age. She has two children, Pedro (age 11) and Jazmín (age 2). They live together in their own home in the central village of Canayre in the District of Llochegua. Zenaida is a hardworking woman who learned how to farm at a young age. When she decided to start her family, she moved to this part of the Peruvian jungle and settled in the central village of Canayre. She used the few resources she had to acquire a parcel of cacao farmland where she now operates a recreational park with a swimming pool and children’s games. Through this business, she is able to generate income for the welfare of her family. It has been a year since she lost her husband due to illness. At that moment, Zenaida had to take over all of her husband’s responsibilities. She does not give up and is excited about continuing the work of her husband. If possible, she would like to improve their recreational park.

This is her second loan with MFP. Zenaida promises to complete her payments on time. She is a woman who is committed to the tasks of her Communal Bank. With this loan of 3000 PEN, Zenaida will invest in the renovation of her recreational facility.

loans.use: to renovate her recreational facility.

loans.name: Fazilamo

texts.ru: Фазиламо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 34 года. Она замужем. У нее имеется двое детей. Она более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en: Fazilamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 34 years old and married. She has two children. She has been doing animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. She breeds cattle for future resale. Fazilamo is taking out the loan to buy a milk cow to increase the head count of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 24, while the youngest is seven. Her husband is a construction worker.

Alejandra has raised and sold hogs for fifteen years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pigs, feed and vitamins.

Alejandra works hard to support her family and send her children to school. In the future, Alejandra would like to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 25-year-old college student who is studying to get his master degree in social studies at the university.

To be able to pay his school tuition, Hamzeh opened a small food market in his area where he sells snacks, juice, and other types of food products.

Now Hamzeh has applied for this loan to redecorate the store and fill it with more food products to get a higher profit out of it.

loans.use: To redecorate the store and fill it with more food products

loans.name: Gbenonkpo-Akpokpota Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Héleine(qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Robert. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont encore à leur charge. L'un des enfants est scolarisé. Héleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Héleine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Héleine prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. Héleine exerce cette activité depuis deux ans, ce qui lui permet de faire face aux diverses charges de la maison. Héleine s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Héleine et les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA group consists of four people who all live together in the same house. The group's representative, Héleine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is married to a man named Robert. The couple have two children who are still dependent on them. One of the children is in school. Héleine lives together with her children and her husband. Héleine has very little schooling.
To provide for herself and for her family, Héleine prepares food that she sells as a street vendor. Héleine has been working as a street vendor for two years, and this enables her to cope with the household expenses. Héleine buys her provisions in one of the markets in Benin.
This is the first time Héleine and the other members of the GBENONKPO-AKPOKPOTA group have requested financial support from ALIDé so that they can strengthen their financial capacity and better respond to their customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen D. 33 años D. edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., la cual pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Maria del Carmen desD. hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos D. su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.   

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar D. alimento para engordar a sus animales y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad D. vida.  Maria del Carmen es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a su familia y que logren sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 33 years old, lives with her husband and children in a house they own, the house doesn't have basic services, it is located in the rural are of TambogranD., which belongs to the department of Piura, characterized by farming and craft activities.

For a few years Maria del Carmen has raised sheep, her barn is only a few minutes from her house where there is plenty of space for the sheep, she feeds them with grass and balanced feed to achieve an ideal growth rate and offer them to the different markets around the area and obtain good profits to cover family expenses.

She has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternative of 800 new soles to buy feed for her livestock and sell them at the best price possible, with the income she will repay her loan and improve her quality of life, Maria del Carmen is a dedicated person that only wants to proviD. some comfort to her family and help them achieve their goals.

loans.use: To buy feed for her livestock and fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Mahouvivi Group

texts.fr: MAHOUVIVI est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Pascaline. Les membres du groupe vendent ensemble dans le même marché au Bénin. Pascaline est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Hervé. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Pascaline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Afin de satisfaire à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Pascaline vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, oignons, ails, etc.) et des épices. A côté de cela Pascaline vend des perles. Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Pascaline s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Pascaline et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUVIVI sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaires et leur revenu.
texts.en:
MAHOUVIVI is a group composed of three persons whose representative is named Pascaline (the one with the hand raised in the photo). Together, the group members are sellers at the same market in Benin. Pascaline is 36 years old and married to Hervé. They have four children, all in school and in their care. Pascaline lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly meet for the various family needs. 

Pascaline halted her studies in middle school. In order to support herself and her children, she sells various goods (pasta, onions, garlic, etc.) and spices. Aside from this, she sells beads. She has been in this business for three years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Pascaline and the other members of the group MAHOUVIVI have requested a loan from ALIDé to expand their business and to increase their sales and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy boxes of pasta, baskets of onions, and sacks of garlic

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a businessman, age 39. He is married and blessed with three children. 

For the last 14 years, he has been managing a green grocer to make a living. He also practices dairy farming for extra income. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 KES to buy carrots, onions and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy carrots, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a loving mother of two. She is married and her children are now attending school. Because of difficulties in providing her children their needs, Jocelyn’s husband goes abroad and works as a driver. Her husband's remittances are used for the household expense of their family in the Philippines.
With the determination to help her husband provide for their children's expenses, Jocelyn started a hog-raising business one year ago. Because of delayed remittances from her husband, she is not able to meet the maintenance of her hogs on time. Jocelyn made a decision to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She looks forward to the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: El señor Timoteo, nacido en Cochabamba,  el es agricultor hace bastantes años, no esta casado pero convive con la Sra. Peregrina ella es ama de casa, el vive y trabaja en su parcela distante a 10 km de la localidad de Limoncito, hacia el este en una comunidad llamada los amarillos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, yuca, y sorgo, y como en su zona no hay agua potable la vida es medio difícil, ya que tienen  que trasladar agua de lugares distantes o sacar de posos,  por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de construir un tanque para deposito de agua, hace tres secuencias viene que viene trabajando con la institución , por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con la institución por  el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Timoteo was born in Cochabamba and has been a farmer for many years. He is not married but lives in partnership with Peregrina who is a housewife. He lives and works on his land some ten kilometers from the town of Limoncito east of a community called Los Amarillos.

He works in agriculture growing corn, cassava, and sorghum. In this area there is no drinking water and life is difficult as they have to bring the water from distant places or draw it from wells. He has seen the necessity of building a water tank. He has been working with the communal bank for three cycles and feels very grateful to the bank for the support it has given.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to construct a water tank

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 49-year-old, Lebanese divorced woman living with her two children who are studying at the university and working at the same time. In 2003, Sanaa started to work as a private teacher receiving students at her home. She works, at the same time, in a local school to be able to afford the heavy expenses. Today, she’s looking to borrow 2,000 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to supply the teaching room with the needed equipment such as teaching tools and board, in addition to a heater so that the students can study properly and comfortably.

loans.use: to supply the teaching room with the needed equipment such as teaching tools and board, in addition to a heater so that the students can study properly and comfortably

loans.name: Lesvia Amelia

texts.es: Lesvia Amelia, de 37 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana de segunda mano,desde hace 10 años de edad,nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha hido bien en su negocio,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa americana de segunda mano,ya que de la misma manera ha ha tenido la oportunidad agrandar mas sus negocio,el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Lesvia Amelia is 37 years old and her business is selling second-hand American clothing.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She tells us that, thanks to God, her business has done well.  She is requesting a loan to buy second-hand American clothing as this will give her the opportunity to further expand her business.  Lesvia's dream is to have a larger sales location and better income.

loans.use: to buy American clothing

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Sokleang (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband, Dy, is 39 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have two daughters who are in high school. 

Sokleang is a fish seller, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of 1,200 USD to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Aníbal a sus 59 años de edad es padre de cinco hijos, se dedica desde hace 22 años a la venta de productos comestibles como dulces y snacks de manera ambulante, es decir, sin un puesto fijo en las calles, su sitio de trabajo es en el parque principal del municipio de bello ubicado al norte de Antioquia, el cual recorre caminando con el carro adecuado con sus productos. El señor Aníbal desea comprar surtido para su negocio y así poder aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño del señor Aníbal es poder ayudarles a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en: Sr. Anibal, 59, has five children.  He has worked as a street vendor for 22 years, selling sweets and snacks to passers-by.  He normally targets customers in the main city park in Bello, a town in northern Antioquia.  He owns a cart, loaded with the merchandise he sells, and moves from place to place as he needs to.  Sr. Anibal wants to stock his business so that he can increase his sales and improve his quality of life.  His goal is to help his children finish their studies and find good-paying jobs.

loans.use: compra de surtido

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим ответственный и добросовестный семьянин. Более 20 лет она занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как кукурузы, пшеницы и помидор. Кроме этого он дома занимается скотоводством, а также переработкой абрикоса. Имеет хорошую репутацию и опыт в бизнесе. Абдурахим хочет перерабатывать свою землю и для этого ему нужно минеральных удобрений. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и поддержку.
texts.en: Abdurahim is a responsible and conscientious family man.  He has been growing crops such as corn, wheat and tomatoes for more than twenty years.  At home he also works in animal husbandry and processes apricots.   He enjoys a good reputation and is experienced in his field.   Abdurahim would like to convert his land and for this he needs mineral fertilizers.  In order to buy fertilizers, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 Somoni (TJS).  He looks forward to your assistance and thanks you in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mirian Margoth

texts.es:
Marian MargotH tiene 29 años es casada, vive con la esposa  e  hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace cuatro años.

Mirian Margot  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres vender productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marian Margoth is twenty-nine, married, and lives with her husband and children in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache in Mocache Canton. 

The El Progresso communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache in the Mocache canton and has supported short-season crop farming like corn and rice for four years.

Mirian Margoth earns her living farming rice and corn. She buys supplies in Mocache and sells her product in the Mocache market. 

She requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The loan has helped her bring in more income for her family and for investment in her crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. She really enjoys selling natural products in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and runs a food café which has been in operation for five years. She started the business from personal savings. Judith learned of Milango from friends. 
Judith is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the business premises. Her future ambition is to open another cafeteria. The main challenges she faces are price fluctuations and the high cost of purchasing equipment/stock.  Judith will use the additional income from this loan to purchase a water tank for the business.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia believes that, "a person with strong determination becomes successful". She is 42 years old and a mother of five. Despite the hardships of living, they aimed to improve their sources  of income and educate their children. Both of them are farmers and they help each other in managing their rice farming business. They also operates a motorcycle transport to earn additional income. 

Olivia is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to be used in buying gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport to be used daily passengers used. She believes that they can able to generate more income as they continue to work hard and strive harder. They are hoping that someday, they will improve their status of living and becomes financially stable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle transport

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 44 ans, Abla est une femme qui vit à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Abla est une marchande de laitues qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander des plateaux d’œufs, des unités de macaronis, de mayonnaises et des unités de boules de pâte bandée afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.

loans.use: Acheter 08 plateaux d'oeufs, 05 unités de mayonnaises, 10 unités de macaronis et 20 unités de boules de pâtes bandées.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
A. Pamela is an active member of Life in Africa. She is currently working in the Invisible Children Bracelet project making bracelets and she is earning a good salary for her efforts.

She live in the camp known as the Acholi Quarters where thousands who were forced to flee the war in the North have settled. She lives with her uncle but he has no work to do and so they are dependent on her income. She realizes that if there were some work for him to do their lives could be so much better and he would be happy to have work that would bring income to the household. And so she studied their situation and came up with a plan.

Groundnuts are consumed in great quantities by the Acholi. They grind these nuts and use them in sauces and nuts that are already ground are in good demand. Therefore, a local small scale business of grinding and packaging the groundnuts would be very suitable for her uncle to do. To accomplish this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to start the business. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months. Her break down:

1, Large paste miller @ 600,000/=

2,100kgs of groundnut @ 80,000/=

3, Transport 15,000/=

4, House rent for one month with power @ 45,000/=

5, packaging 30,000/=

6, others 30,000/=

Total is 800,000/=

WE Team to benefit: Community quarrantee lending

loans.use: Ground paste wholesale and Retail Business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary who born in 1979 with household of 2 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Mary who is a educated women but due to family problem she cant able to work outside then she decide to take loan from AFSG and continue the tailoring business in her home.

She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG, who can continue with her business and find more income that she can able to pay her children's fee and house payment.

loans.use: To buy fabric, new muchine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Mary F. is a resident of Nkurankan and operates a drink stand. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Operates a drink stand.

loans.name: Huseyinaga

texts.en: Huseyinaga was born in 1970 and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has 2 children. He has been in this business for 7 years. Now he applies for a loan of $475 to buy hay.

loans.use: To buy hay

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Mirna Yolanda and I have a small business selling new clothing. I work as a street vendor, selling my clothes in the neighborhood. I've been working at this business for several years. The great thing is that I can both earn an income and look after my family because this business allows me to arrange my schedule around the family. Because the approaching months are the best for my sales, I need to stock a little extra so that I can offer my clients a range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Mirna Yolanda, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa l nueva la que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad, lo mas importante es que puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, ya este negocio me permite programar las diferentes actividades familiares. Tomando en cuena que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta, necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy underwear, sandals, blouses, men's pants and other goods for resell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana E. is 45 years old, the married mother of 8 children; she lives in Benin in Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provision and drinks and has been in business since 1992. She is in need of a loan of US$ 550 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Suzan's Group

texts.en:
Suzan K. sells clothing and wants a loan to purchase additional inventory.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora F. is a 66 year old womanwho has lived a hard life. Earlier in her life her husband passed away, and she was left alone to care for her blind daughter. Together she and her daughter live in an apartment in Villa Elisa. A few years ago, after the death of her husband, Pastora needed a source of income to support herself and her daughter. Opening her own grocery store was a perfect business because it allowed her to be close to her daughter who needs constant care.

She works there everyday and is hoping to expand her goods and clientele. The loan is very important to Pastora because it will allow her to better the quality of her goods and gain numerous clients. She currently rents the space in which her grocery store is located but is working towards the goal of gaining a space of her own.

loans.use: To buy oil, meat, flour, eggs, ice cream and drinks.

loans.name: Nsaggu Akugoba Group

texts.en: After she failed to have a second child, Harriet’s husband left her for another woman, but this did not stop her from caring for her girl, who has now given her 7 grandchildren. She is 48 years old and has had a drug shop business at her home for 20 years, while she has been our client for 9 years. On top of this business, she also has a charcoal trading business, as well as a business selling spare car parts that she co-owns with her son-in-law. Her loan is to help her buy more drugs and buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: Harriet intends to buy more drugs, like Panadol and Fansidar, and charcoal.

loans.name: Fatish

texts.en:
Fatish V. has been selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam. Fatish owns a shop in front of his house. His friend who is an IDP from Aghdam offered to start a small business together with him. They will buy leather, order jackets in tailor shops, and sell them out of Fatish’s shop.

Fatish’s daughter will be helping them to sell jackets among women in the Qarachukhur district where they live. Women's jackets are being sold faster. Most of the people that live in their neighborhood are IDPs from Aghdam and there are good connections between them, so it won’t be a problem to sell their new jackets that will be 40-50% cheaper than in shops.

Fatish needs this loan as his share to put into this business venture with his friend.

loans.use: Purchase of leather to have jackets made to sell

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Ms. Lizet U. M. is 21 years old and she studied pharmaceutical chemistry. She has one dependent son. She lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province. She began her business by selling beauty products and it was successful but she decided to start another business, one related to her studies. With effort and dedication she was able to set up a pharmacy that sells many medicinal products. She set up this business with her community in mind since there are no other pharmacies in the neighborhood. In this way she is able to help meet the needs of her community since community member are always in need of healing illness. She belongs to Banco Comunal “Bendicion de Dios, where she obtained her first loan of 300.00 soles, which allowed her to buy beauty products on sale in order to stock her business. With the 1000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in four moths, she will buy a variety of medicine direct from the labs and that are guaranteed, as well as a large display case where she will display her products. Ms. Lizet dreams with expanding her business and setting up another pharmacy in other places that need one.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lizet U. M. tiene 21 años de edad, estudio la carrera de Químico farmacéutico. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir, Provincia de Trujillo Su negocio se inicio con la venta de productos de belleza le iba bien pero decidió emprender otro negocio, su propio negocio en el que pueda ejercer su carrera. Con esfuerzo y dedicación inicio una botica en la que ofrece productos medicinales. Este negocio lo inicio pensando en su comunidad ya que por la zona donde vive no existe una botica. De esta manera ayuda en las necesidades de su comunidad ya que la mayoría de gente siempre necesita aliviar sus males. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con lo cual compro productos de belleza que estuvieron en oferta para así tener en stock. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses, comprará una variedad de medicinas en las diferentes distribuidoras que traen directo de laboratorio y están garantizados, así también una vitrina grande para allí exhibir sus productos. La señora Lizet sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, instalando otra botica en otros lugares que lo necesiten.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para su venta

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born on December 31, 1964 in Goga and presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). Married and the father of two children, Mr. Kokou A. is a primary school teacher. His meager salary, often late to arrive, is not sufficient to cover expenses for his family which is the reason why he has begun to grow corn, at which he is succeeding well. He is requesting a loan to expand his field and purchase fertilizer. This will allow him to have a good harvest and contribute more toward improving living conditions for the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou est né le 31 décembre 1964 à Goga et vit actuellement à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, Monsieur A. Kokou est un enseignant du cours primaire. Son maigre salaire qui tarde à tomber n’arrive pas à combler les charges familiales c’est pour cela qu’il s’est lancé dans la culture du maïs ce qui lui réussit bien. Il sollicite un financement pour renforcer son champ et acheter des engrais. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir un bon rendement et contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use:
purchase of fertilizer and expansion of his corn field

Achat d'engrais et élargissement de champ de mais

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son H., 27, sells fish in the market, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Toeung Tearum, is a 33-year-old fisherman and earns approximately $6 per day. They have four children, all of whom are young and live at home with the family in Porpy Village, Kampong Thom Province.

H. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle and trailer to use for their businesses and for family transportation. This purchase will enable the couple to expand their business as well as improve their quality of life. (The picture is H.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and trailer to use for their businesses and for family transportation

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mr. Yong Y. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer and firewood seller. His wife, Mrs. Khon Sun, is also a farmer. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school.

The older child (working in the garment factory), is married but still lives with his parents. Mr. Yong Y. wants them to have a place of their own but he does not have enough money to build them a new house. Thus, he is requesting a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mr. Yong Y. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart and he has already repaid that loan in full.

loans.use: To build a separate house for his married children.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Agée de 56 ans, A. Béatrice est une femme entreprenante qui se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Mariée, elle a 09 personnes à sa charge et fait le commerce de yaourt et de petits condiments depuis 30 ans déjà. Les maigres revenus qu’elle en tire ne lui permettent pas de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nombreuse. 

Son mari vieillissant ne dispose plus de force nécessaires pour exercer son métier d’agriculteur. A. se retrouve donc seul face à des responsabilités énormes. 
      
Elle a besoin de soutien à travers un crédit pour promouvoir son activité   .
texts.en:
Béatrice A. is 56 years old and an enterprising woman who struggles for the success of her children. Married, she cares for nine people by selling yogurt and small condiments during the last 30 years. Her meager earnings do not allow her to take care of the needs of her large family. Her aging husband does not have the necessary strength to practice his job of farmer. A. therefore finds herself facing large responsibilities alone. She needs support by means of a loan to promote her activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: Dame B. Rita est née le 28/07/1952 à Djougou, une ville du Nord Bénin. Elle est mariée à AGUEY ZINSOU Marc et est mère de 02 enfants qui sont à leur charge. Elle vend du charbon, d'huile végétale et autres produits de consommation courante depuis cinq ans et habite le quartier Hindé depuis quarante ans. Pour faire face à la demande de ses clients et pour mieux les satisfaire elle sollicite pour la cinquième fois un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. was born 7/28/1952 in Djougou, a city in north Bénin. She is married to Marc Aguey Zinsou and is a mother of two. She has been selling coal, vegetable oil and other everyday consumer goods for five years and has lived in the Hindé area for four years. To meet the demands of her customers and to better satisfy them, she is seeking a loan from Alidé for the fifth time.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of coal, drums of vegetable oil, bags of corn, and misc. everyday products

loans.name: Sok-Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-aun Y., 34, is widow with one daughter. She lives with her parents and one brother and one sister in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sok-aun started weaving silk three years ago, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Miguel Fausto

texts.es:
Miguel es chofer de trufi de servicio publico inter ciudad La Paz - El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos, vive en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la conversión de combustible de su automóvil, de gasolina a GNC (Gas Natural Comprimido), esto hará que ahorre combustible en 50% del costo. 


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Miguel is a public service Trufi driver (Trufi drivers offer a taxi-like service but with a fixed route) between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. It is his main source of income which provides for his children. He lives in the area of Ciudad Satélite (Satellite City) in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to convert his automobile from gasoline to natural gas. This will cut his fuel costs by 50%. It is his first loan with Impro. Our assessment shows that we can allow for the approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools for car maintenance work

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar was born in 1958. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is single. Three years ago he started this business. He transports people with his minibus. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 24 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de sus suegros. Siempre le ha gustado la preparación de dulces y pasteles, pero nunca pudo abrir un local para este negocio, pero eso no le impidió a que se dedique a lo que le agrada, desde hace 2 años prepara diversos bocaditos, los cuales los hace en casa de su suegra, quien también le ayuda a prepararlos, por lo general prepara solo para pedidos de las diferentes tiendas de los alrededores, las cuales piden cada quincena, y Miriam trata de atender a varias personas para que las ganancias le permitan cooperar con los gastos de la familia. Con su trabajo garantiza pagar sus cuotas de devolución del préstamo y seguirá trabajando con este grupo de su banco comunal. Miriam invertirá en la compra de moldes de torta y otros implementos para atender compromisos como matrimonios y fiestas infantiles, donde son muy solicitadas las tortas decoradas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 24-years old and lives with her husband and daughter in her in-laws’ house. She has always loved preparing sweets and cakes, and although she could never afford to open a store she has been making and selling baked goods from home for the last 2 years. Her mother-in-law helps, but Miriam usually fulfills the requests from different stores in the area by herself. The orders come in every 2 weeks and she works hard to meet demand so that her earnings can go towards the family’s expenses. Her business ensures she will be able to make her loan payments and continue working with her community bank group. Miriam plans to buy baking pans and other kitchen tools for special orders such as decorated cakes for weddings and children’s parties.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baking utensils for making cakes

loans.name: Sharifabonu

texts.en:
Sharifabonu Z. is 30 years old. She is married with 3 adorable kids. Sharifabonu has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling kids' clothing at a busy market in Khujnad called “Panjshanbe”. Sharifabonu currently has one sales place at the market. Eventually, she would like to open a store in a permanent facility. She has requested a loan of 300 USD to help purchase new inventory. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. She will be able to help many kids keep dry and warm through the cold winter months and hopes to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr: Née le 10/01/1970 au Ghana, Mme Madina O. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfant. C'est une commerçante de condiments pour la sauce et de charbon de bois. Ce petit commerce lui permet de pouvoir prendre en ses enfants. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux contribuer aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on the 10th of January 1970 in Ghana, Mrs. Madina O. is married and has five (05) children. She is a retailer of condiments for sauce and of firewood. This small business allows her to take care of her children. She is asking for a loan to expand her display of goods. In this way, she will be able to better contribute to meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household products

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea N. is 52 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she and her husband make a daily income by growing vegetables on their own farmland in the village. The family currently grows corn, cabbages, and rice. They are widely known in the business because they learned the skill from their grandparents.

The couple has been married for years and has five children: three are single and the others are married and live separately. The family are facing a problem due to the water system which is far away from their crops so that Chea N. is applying a loan to buy a pump for irrigating crops.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigating crops

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. started her fish sales fifteen years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Aba prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. No wonder her husband is a fisherman. She also sells foodstuffs like bags of maize. She treks to Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo to buy her foodstuffs. She has a high customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She is now 51 years old, married and a mother with four children. Her husband is a seaman who fishes in the sea. Currently all her children are fully independent. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fish and bags of maize to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the village bank called Holy Ghost. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more fish and bags of maize.

loans.name: Mrs. Somaly Lung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirty-one people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Somaly L. is a 42-year-old village bank president.  She is a hard working woman. She also is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed off the farm while the others are attending the local school. 

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
Уктам Холов  родился в 1979 году. Женат, отец 4 детей. Проживает в Истаравшане.
 Имеет десятилетний трудовой стаж. Он мастер-столяр по изготавливанию дверей и окон. Сырьем в его деле служит дерево.Для закупа сырья ему необходимы денежные средства. Узнав о нашем Фонде от соседа, который так же является нашим активным клиентом, он обратился к нам, за помощью. Ознакомился с условиями кредитования и подал заявку на получение кредита в размере 1600 сомони.
 Отец Уктама Холова живет вместе со своим сыном и его семьей, и вкладывает в семейные расходы часть суммы, получаемой от своей работы повором в сельской средней школе. Он поддержал своего сына в вопросе получения кредита от "Микроинвест", и уверен что после использования полученного кредита, дела его сына ускорятся и  улучшатся.
texts.en:
Uktam H. was born in 1979. He is married and is a father of four children. He lives in Istaravshan and has a ten year experience at his job. He is a carpenter and makes doors and windows. The raw material is mostly wood and to buy the raw materials he needs financial means. He has found out about this fund from a neighbor who is also our current client, so Uktam has come for help.
He has become familiar with the lending terms and has applied for a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni (US$425). Uktam's father lives together with Ukram's family and adds his earnings from his job working as a cook in a village school into the family's budget and expenses. He supported his son in the decision to take out a loan from MicroInvest and is certain that after using this loan his son's business will speed up and improve.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials - wood

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia B. is from the village of Panalsalan, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Venancia operates a "sari-sari" or general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Venancia has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Venancia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro
