texts.es: La señora Ligia del Socorro B., tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto con sus compañero de vida, el cual trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo, una hija de 19 años , y una varón de cuatro años , los dos estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , poder dividir los cuartos , ella desde hace siete años trabaja como comerciante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las ventas bajas , ya que hasta casi el 50% de mercadería tienen descuento .Con el Financiamiento va a comprar nuevos productos de moda tanto ropa , como bisutería y zapatos. Para ofertar a sus clientes productos de variedad.
texts.en:
Ligia del Socorro Balando, 39, lives in the Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla together with her life mate. He works to help her with the household expenses. They care for two children, a 19 year old daughter and a 4 year old son. Both children currently attend school. The plans for the family are to improve their living conditions and be able to divide the rooms. She has been a storekeeper for seven years. The biggest difficulties that present themselves are the lack of financing and the low sales. Almost 50% of the merchandise is discounted. She will use the loan to buy new fashion products like clothes, jewelry, and shoes. She will then offer her customers variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, and jewelry

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is dressmaker who runs a small shop in the town of Rongo, Kenya. Her shop, called “Jakonyango”, has been around for over ten years. She currently employs three people who all operate sewing machines that she owns.

Alice hopes to add two more sewing machines and an increased range of fabrics and materials. Along with her husband’s income from his welding activities, Alice hopes to make enough money to pay for food and school fees for her three children, aged 6 to 12.

loans.use: To add two sewing machines and an increased range of fabrics

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina atiende con el servicio de fotocopias, en una pequeña tienda ubicada en la ciudad, en un lugar muy concurrido, esta situado detrás de un colegio, por esto que le va bien en el negocio.  Vive en la zona de Pampahasi con su pequeño hijo y su mamá, ella apoya en los gastos de la casa. Estudiaba por la nocha en la facultad de medicina, terminó sus estudios con mucho esfuerzo y ahora tiene la oportunidad de abrir su propio consultorio en la plaza Garita de Lima, de la zona 14 de septiembre un lugar muy concurido ya que es zona comercial.La fotocopiadora la atenderá un familiar. El crédito será invertio en la compra del instrumental que le hace falta para su consultorio a inaugurarse muy pronto, atenderá en medicina general con costos bajos para que las personas de bajos recursos puedan acceder al servicio.
texts.en:
Cristina has a photocopying service. It is in a small shop located in the city in a well transited place. It is located behind a school and therefore business is good. She lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood with her young son and her mother, and helps out with household expenses. She studied medicine at night at the university, and with great effort she completed her degree. She now has the opportunity to open her own medical practice in the Garita de Lima plaza, in the 14 de septiembre neighborhood. It is a well transited area since it is a commercial zone. A relative will work at the photocopying service. The loan will be used to purchase instruments that she needs for her medical practice which will open very soon. She will provide a low cost general practice so that low income individuals can use her services.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase instruments for her medical practice

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a vegetable trader in an open-air market in Thika. He specializes in wholesale trading in vegetables such as cabbages, potatoes, onions, carrots and cucumbers. He buys the produce directly from farmers in the rural areas of Matuu, a rich agricultural area, transports them and then sells them to residents and small-scale retailers in Thika, Nairobi and the coastal region. He has been doing this for the last four years but the declining rainfalls are threatening crop production. Paul has requested a loan of KES 50,000 in order to increase his stock of potatoes, cabbages and carrots in readiness for the holy month of Ramadhan, as demand for these products is quite high then.

loans.use: To increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married with one daughter. She sells all kinds of food in her own little store. The store is located in a good area that brings many clients. Svetlana has operated this business for 7 years. She always offers good and fresh products. Her clients know and value this. Svetlana is honest, entrepreneurial and hard working. She makes every effort to make her business a nice and attractive place for her customers. Svetlana is requesting a loan of 9,550 Ukranian hryvnia (or about $1150) to diversify her store's stock. She hopes to use the additional income to improve her business conditions.

loans.use: To diversify her store's stock

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun L., 41, and her husband Mr. Bros Khvan, 35, live aL. national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1997 and have one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and the other stays at home. 
 
Sokhoeun has been producing rice wine and raising pigs for twelve years, a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband has been a full-time driver for two years. Sokhoeun is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build a hall for producing rice wine and also to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To build a hall for producing rice wine and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Messanvi

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge ; en 2005, il s’est lancé dans la vente de produits congelés et de poissons. Il exerce cette activité dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Il revend ses produits congelés et ses poissons aux femmes revendeuses de ces produits dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il vend aussi ses produits à des ménages ; il dispose de bons réfrigérateurs qui conservent bien ses poissons et viandes ; c’est pour cela que sa boutique est très visitée et appréciée de beaucoup de personnes. Actuellement il a besoin de commander des poissons et poulets à conserver. Pour cette raison, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour effectuer ces achats. Il a la certitude qu’il remboursera son crédit à temps.

loans.use: Achat de poissons et de viandes congelées

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel Bertrán Laínez tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy responsable y virtuosa. Ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 17 años que inicio este negocio, y por medio de su esposo quien le ayudo a obtener un cerdo, por lo que Maria ya sabía muy bien el destace así fue como dio inicio a este negocio y experimento muy buenas ganancias por lo que fue muy importante para empezar este negocio y ella misma ser su propia jefa. Maria tiene muchos sueños, pero el que más le gustaría cumplir es de conseguir su propio tramo en el mercado para obtener muchos más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, cuchillos y además pagar el transporte del traslado del cerdo.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel Bertrán Laínez is 46 years old and a responsible and virtuous woman. She has one dependent child. For more than 17 years, Maria has been in the business of selling pork. She began her business when her husband helped her obtain pigs for butchering. She has become very skilled at her business and has generated good earnings.

Maria feels it was very important for her to start her business so that she could be her own boss. She has many aspirations. One of them is to obtain her own vending stall in the market so that she can gain more customers.

The loan Maria is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase pigs and knives. Part of the proceeds will be used to pay the transportation costs for moving the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her pork business

loans.name: Ndoliba

texts.en:
Ndoliba is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to two children. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ndoliba works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a petty trader. Ndoliba trades in all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Ndoliba has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Babulu

texts.en:
Babulu H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Babulu is 35 years old and is married to a soldier. She has ten children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida D. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Adelaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Eduvis Eufemia

texts.es:
Euduvis P. de 32 años, de la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta ubicada en un lugar periurbano, tiene una casa de ladrillos solo con luz y con falta casi de todos los servicios básicos, ella empezó vendiendo caramelos, juguetes, láminas y otros  artículos para los niños fuera de una escuela cercana de su casa.

Cuando ya la conocieron ella se puso un negocio en su casa pero aun va a vender plumas, lápices, cuadernos, láminas  a la escuela a la entrada que es 6:30Am-7:30Am y a la salida de 12:00-13:00Pm.

Euduvis vio que en su sector no solo eran indispensables los útiles para los niños sino los víveres de comida y quiere comenzar comprando azúcar, arroz, huevos y aceites, ya que su esposo es maestro albañil y le ayuda con los gastos de la familia pero no es suficiente porque tiene 3 hijos pequeños la mayor tiene 7 años, y están en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere implementar vendiendo azúcar, arroz, huevos y fideos para así agrandarlo a mas de los útiles, en el futuro quiere  mejorar su tienda surtida para poder tener a sus hijos en una mejor escuela y poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Euduvis P. is 32 years old and lives in the zone of Paraíso in Guayaquil, which is located in the outskirts of the city. She has a brick house with only electricity and lacks almost all basic services. She began selling sweets, toys, posters, and other things for children outside of a school near her house. When they got to know her, she moved the business to her house, but she still goes to sell pens, pencils, notebooks, and posters when school begins (between 6:30 and 7:30 am) and ends (between 12:00 and 1:00 pm). Euduvis saw that in her neighborhood not only were school supplies essential but also food supplies are. She would like to buy sugar, rice, eggs, and oils. Her husband is a bricklayer and she helps him with the household expenses, but she is not able to help enough now because they have 3 young children. The oldest is 7 years old and they are are in public school. With this loan, she would like to begin selling sugar, rice, eggs, and noodles to expand her business. In the future, she would like to improve her store and keep it stocked so that she can send her children to a better school and fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Yesenia Lucia

texts.es: Yesenia Lucia es madre luchadora tiene 2 hijos y están estudiando. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 4 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia.
texts.en:
Yesenia Lucia is a fighting mother of two children who are studying. Her activity is a general store located in her home. This is where she began her sales, little by little increasing her inventory. She has been working at this business for 4 years, during which she has always fought for her and her children to stay afloat, despite the difficulties she has had to face, because she wants to be able to offer her children everything they need. She is very happy with her work because without it she would not have enough to eat every day. Her biggest dream is to increase her business and be more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa owns a computer center in his town. His customers are students who come to do research and children who come to play games. In addition, he sells computer accessories.

Today, Moussa is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy more computers in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es muy entusiasta y trabajador, tiene 48 años y siempre está buscando la manera de ser una mejor persona y bueno en su trabajo. Se separó de su esposa, pero siempre recibe la visita de sus hijos: Víctor de 22 años y Leydi de 17, ellos son su motivo para salir adelante. 

Él tiene un taller donde confecciona zapatillas, le gusta mucho su trabajo y lo realiza con gran alegría, pues los 20 años que tiene de experiencia le han dado por resultado buenas ganancias y calidad en sus zapatillas.
Wilfredo cuenta con una máquina propia, la cual le da la ventaja de trabajar a las horas que vea por necesario, muchas veces se ha quedado hasta altas horas de la noche para poder entregar el pedido, ya que la responsabilidad es lo fundamental para él. 
En un futuro, espera comprar mayor cantidad de máquinas y así agrandar su taller y su producción.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien a la hora de realizar sus pagos, gracias a su compromiso y puntualidad. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cuero y otros materiales para elaborar sus zapatillas. Él espera muy pronto alcanzar las metas que se trazó, pues quiere que sus hijos estén muy orgullosos de él.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is very enthusiastic and hardworking. He is 48 years old, and is always looking for a way to be a better person and to be good at his job. He separated from his wife, but he is always being visited by his children: Victor, 22; and Leydi, 17. They are his motivation to succeed. He has a workshop where he makes sneakers. He enjoys the work very much, and carries it out cheerfully. As a result of his 20 years of experience, he has good earnings and makes quality shoes. Wilfredo has his own machine, which gives him flexibility in scheduling his work hours. Many times he has remained until the very late hours of the night in order to fulfill an order, since responsibility is fundamental for him. In the future, he hopes to buy a greater quantity of machines and in this way expand his workshop and his production. This is his second loan with MFP and up until now he has done very well making his payments on time, thanks to his commitment and punctuality. With the money that he requests now he will buy leather and other materials to make his sneakers. He hopes that very soon he will accomplish the goals that he laid out, since he wants his children to be proud of him.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make sneakers

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn A. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Edelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to cook. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to cook

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa I. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Ma. Theresa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling electronic load (mobile phone prepaid credits or airtime) in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane C. is a 28-year-old woman and is married to Luke K Meli, who is a farmer. They have three lovely children. She lives in Kapsaos in Eldoret where Jane grows vegetables to sell, such as cabbages and kale.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and the market women to whom she sells her vegetables wholesale. She has been in this business for seven years now. She not only sells vegetables but also does a little dairy farming as a secondary business.

Jane came to know about KADET through a friend of hers who is also a KADET client. She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy farm supplies like different vegetable seeds for planting.

Her dream is to own a shop in Eldoret town where she can sell her vegetables and also to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Danaya (Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 5 femmes (4 mariées et 1 veuve) de Koutiala ville qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles élargies  avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femme fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les condiments, les poissons fumé et séché, les légumes etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Rabiata Dembélé est un membre du groupe  qui vend du bois de chauffe.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de camion en  bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs. Elle se procure  du bois dans les différents coins de brousse. Son stock de bois, qui est très important, est entreposé dans un endroit devant la porte. Elle vend le bois en gros, en détail et au comptant à la maison  à une clientèle composé de femmes et d’hommes. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Rabiata Dembélé compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a grouping of five women (four married and one a widow) from Koutiala Town, who know each other well because they live in extended large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 42 years of age and have an average of three children each. This group of women sell a variety of articles such as firewood, clothes, condiments, smoked and dried fish, vegetables etc. In order to increase the level of their activities, the members decided five years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are now on their twelfth group loan and all the previous loans were repaid on time. Rabiata Dembélé is a member of the group and she sells firewood. She is planning to use this loan to buy lorry loads of firewood from producers. She gets her wood in different corners of the bush. Her stock of wood, which is very significant, is stored in a place in front of the door. She sells the wood on a wholesale and retail basis, and for cash, from home to a customer base made up of women and men. While the members of the Danaya group expect to make a monthly profit of 110,000FCFA each during the course of the cycle, Rabiata Dembélé expects to make 160,000FCFA. As well as paying off their loans, they use a part of their income to cover everyday family expenses. They would like to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that supplies do not get too short..

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Mr. Chheun V. is a 37-year-old fisherman and father, blessed with five children, all of whom are attending the public high school. In addition to his fishing business, he uses his old motorcycle to deliver passers-by around the community for a fee. His wife, Chea Khan, 38, is a homemaker who cooks delicious meals for the family. 

Chheun V. says he can’t catch many fish because his fishing equipment is not good enough to sustain his business. Thus, he is looking for assistance to be used to buy a boat, nets and traps to better serve him in his fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy a boat, nets and traps.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 35 year old single mother of two. She has been operating a retail shop for five years and sells spare parts and paints to earn a living. Esther was formerly employed and saved her money to start this business because her income could not support her family. She was then introduced to the Masaku Ushindi group in Faulu Kenya. This group has helped her save her money and access a loan from Faulu Kenya. Esther has requested a loan of Kes. 25,000 to add spare parts stock. She hopes to open other outlets in the future to increase her returns.

loans.use: To pruchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Elsa es una mujer esforzada al trabajo, para ayudar a su familia, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio una pulpería,  ya que solo con el salario de su esposo no daba para todos los gastos, ya que su salario es bajo ya que trabaja de conductor.

Con la ayuda de su esposo y los financiamientos de Afodenic logro el aumento de sus productos que día a día vende.
Su casa es sencilla de piedra y madera, que desea en un futuro hacer toda de concreto, ya que con este préstamo lograra invertir más en producto de granos como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, jabón, papel, carnes, pollo, queso con el fin de aumentar las ventas y poder ofrecer todo al cliente, a parte que es lo esencial y lograr mejores ganancias que falta que le hace para pagar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa is a hardworking woman and to help her family, some years back she began her own business, a convenience store, since her husbands' wages are not enough to cover their expenses, he works as a driver.

With the help of her husband and the loans of Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) she was able to increase the products that she sells day to day.

Elsa’s home is simple, made of stone and wood, and in the future she wishes to make her home in concrete. With this loan she will be able to buy more products like: rice, beans, corn, sugar, soap, paper, meats, chicken, and cheese with the goal to increase sales and provide everything needed to her customers and have better earnings which are needed to pay for her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to increase sales like:  rice, beans, corn, sugar, oil, basic goods to make daily foods for Nicaraguans.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla C. is from the village of Greenheights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Prescilla is married and has six adult children. Prescilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main sources of income for the business come from selling both food & daily use products and also buying and selling eggs in the local community. Prescilla has been engaged in her business for less than two years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Prescilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Prescilla is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Prescilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa R. is from the village of Maguikay, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily from manufacturing and selling bamboo products like basket, barbecue stick and more to local businesses and community members.  Marissa has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Marissa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  Marissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her third from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

-----------------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina S. is from the village of Olango. She is 37 years old. Merlina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina raises pigs for fattening and sale. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells her animals.

In 2009, Merlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Merlina's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
This is Rolinda E., 49, resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Federico E. and mother of two college aged young adults. By the grace of God, Rolinda has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard be able to continue supporting her children’s education until they finish college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Rolinda, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Rolinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piecemeal rates. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Rolinda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a successful and stable business other than her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petronila reside en El Transito de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos uno 17 años y el otro de 13 años de edad, los dos dependen económicamente de ella, Petronila se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tiene 40 años de edad, comenzó el negocio por iniciativa propia trabajando desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde. Ella por el momento no posee el capital necesario para realizar una inversión que le permita obtener mayores ingresos.
Ella esta solicitando un Préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Leña y gas que son los materiales que necesita para la elaboración de las tortillas, el préstamo ayudara a que Petronila fortalezca su negocio con más recursos y ganar más ingresos a su hogar. 
El sueño de ella es crecer  con su negocio logrando estabilizarse y proveyendo para sus hijos lo más necesario mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Petronila lives in Transito de San Miguel. She is a single mother of two sons who are 17 and 13 years old. Both children are supported by her. She sells tortillas and is 40 years old. She started her business on her own working from 8am to 5pm. For the time being, she does not have the necessary capital to invest in order to increase her income. She requests a loan to buy corn, wood and gas, which are the materials she needs to make tortillas. The loan will help Petronila strengthen her business with more resources and therefore more income to her home. Her dream is to grow her business, establish herself and provide her children what they need by improving their living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, wood and gas to make tortillas

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. G. is 42 years old, married to a tailor and they have two children aged 22 and 13 whom they hope to give a good education to university level. His business is located with many businesses in a residential area called Eastleigh in Nairobi. He has been selling TVs, DVDs, music systems and other electronic products to repeat customers and walk-in customers. Besides this business, he also owns a clothing business in an open air market known as Muthurwa in Nairobi. He has been doing this business for the past two years and he says that it is profitable. 

The major challenge that James has is that there are too many people in the area with the same kind of business as his so customers are not very loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more electronic products and clothes to grow his businesses. He plans to expand his clothing business and he hopes to own several boutiques in different towns in future. He describes himself as very hard-working, generous and dedicated to his work.

loans.use: To buy electronic products and clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 41 years old and married to Antony Mwangi. They have two children. One daughter, Jenipher, is 20 years old and in college. They live in Kakamega town.

Esther sells used clothes in the open air market. She has been running this business for the last five years and is applying for her first loan. She intends to use the money to buy several bails of used clothes to add to her stock. She hopes to use the profits made to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream is to open up a boutique in the future and start selling ready made clothes.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 10 children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products retail, at the market.    

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas.     She also generates additional income through selling piped water.The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation   and the rainy season .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also educate her children up to university.  

 Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen T. sells cooking utensils and cloth at Abura. Queen has been though senior high school. She is a single parent taking care of her son. She started her business not long ago. She is requesting a loan to enable her to expand her business by buying more cooking utensils and cloth for sale. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. She hopes to save towards her child’s education with the additional income.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and cloth for sale.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, a resident of Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city and known for its history and culture, lives with her family in a four-room brick house in an area named Mughalpura. A 53-year-old widow, Haleema spent a very difficult time after the death of her husband and raised her five children with great hard work. Now her elder sons have grown up and they work to financially support the family.

Her eldest son has a quilt-making and sales business, making warm quilts at home and selling them to various shops in the market. Her next oldest son works in a factory, while the third one operates a vegetable-selling business. The remaining two are young and stay at home. Haleema couldn’t provide them with educational opportunities due to poor financial conditions.

Haleema is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son because the winter season has started and he has a large order to fill. He will use the loan to purchase cotton and cloth in bulk that will enable him to meet the order on time by making good quantity quilts. Haleema is planning his marriage and hopes that the loan profit will help her plans come true.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy cotton and cloth for quilt-making business

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
Âgée de 47ans, mariée mère de 3 enfants et propriétaire d’un restaurant à l’entrée d’un marché qu’elle tient  depuis 7ans.
 Le prêt passé lui a été très bénéfique dans la mesure où elle a su connaître qu’est ce  que la gestion de stock, le journal de caisse et autre stratégie de gestion d’une activité génératrice des revenus.
Elle achète toujours les vivre frais pour éviter de perdre sa marchandise avec le manque d’électricité. Sa clientèle est diversifiée, des vendeurs du marché, des chauffeurs de taxi, des passants qui s’arrête souvent à son restaurant.
Hormis le renforcement de son activité, elle a aussi améliorée ses prestations.
Le prochain prêt sera pour les achats tels que : 1panier de poissons fumés, 1carton de poissons salés, 1bidon d’huile de palme, 1bidon d’huile d’arachides, 1carton de boîtes de tomates, 1filet d’oignons. Les autres denrées seront achetées au fur et à mesure que l’activité évolue.
Ses revenus sont passés de 20000f à 45000f par jour et veut devenir une grande restauratrice afin d’embaucher les jeunes filles mères.
texts.en:
47 years of age, married with three children and the owner of an eatery at the market entrance, which she has been running for seven years. The previous loan proved very beneficial for her since she was able to learn how to manage stock, keep a cash register and other business strategies.
She continues to buy her groceries fresh in order to avoid spoilage of goods due to electricity failures. Her customer base is diversified: market vendors, taxi drivers, passersby who like to stop by at her place.
In addition to strengthening her business, she also increased her income. 

The next loan will be used for purchase such items as one basket of smoked fish, one box of salted fish, one jug of palm oil, one jug of peanut oil, one box of canned tomatoes, one onion braid. 
Her revenues increased from 20,000 to 45,000 West African francs per day, and eventually she would like to have a big food-serving business and employ young unmarried mothers.

loans.use: Purchasing smoked and salted fish, fresh staple foods, oil jog , onion braids, bags of green beans etc

loans.name: Adriana Victoria

texts.es:
Adriana de oficio ebanista, madre soltera de dos hijos,  es  una mujer emprendedora que trabaja mucho para lograr dar a su familia un porvenir mejor.
Trabaja en su casa de habitación haciendo muebles, oficio que aprendió en un taller y que ha sido la solución para tener ingresos, y cuidar de sus hijos. Comenzó con poco dinero lo que necesitaba inversión para darse a conocer  con su trabajo, lo que recurre al crédito en donde Afodenic da su primer financiamiento comprando madera y herramientas.
Logrando mejores resultados de ventas. Con este nuevo préstamo será con el objetivo de invertir en madera, esponjas, pega y otros para seguir con sus ventas. Logrando tener más producción.
texts.en:
Adriana is a furniture maker. She is a single mother of two children and an enterprising woman who works hard to be able to give her family a better future. 

She works in her house making furniture, a trade she learned in a workshop and which has enabled her to earn an income and take care of her children. She started with a little money that she needed to get to know her work. She has turned to getting a loan at Afodenic for her first financing to buy wood and tools.  

She hopes to achieve better sales. With this new loan, her objective is to invest in wood, sponges, glue and more to continue with her sales and have more production.

loans.use: She will buy wood, sponges and glue to make more furniture and have better sales.

loans.name: Nancy Kelid

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera: tiene una hija que tiene 9 años de edad y que se encuentra en etapa escolar. Reside en el sector Villa Hermosa, una zona marginal que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz, una zona situada junto a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Nancy desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 9 year-old daughter who is in school.  She lives in Villa Hermosa sector, a marginal area of Jose Leonardo Ortiz district which is located next to the city of Chiclayo.

Nancy's business is selling beauty products and cosmetics through catalogs.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders she takes, the more points she earns with the company that provides the products and, therefore, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.

Nancy would like to have stable capital with which she could acquire more products and have a stable stock of cosmetics which would enable her customers to acquire the products they need quickly, without having to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are delivered.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more products and to have a stable stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem M., 54, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia – one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. M. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning $2 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Two of her children are employed at a factory, earning $2 US each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $33 US on food and $32 US on other expenses. M. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for the family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Mr. Andres P. 50 years old, single and a resident of Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is a hardworking man. He find ways to make a living to support his immediate family member in order to survive. Andres has been engaged in the buy and sell business for two years already. 

Andres is happy enough that he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. From the start he was able to access fund from the cooperative to start-up his buy and sell business. He successfully repaid all his previous loan availments. Today, he wants to borrow 7,000 PHP to purchase additional working capital.

To have a growing and stable business is what Andres is aiming for.

loans.use: to purchase additional working capital

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny F. is from the town of Surallah. He is 43 years old. Danny is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Danny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Danny works hard to sustain his family. He dreams to see all his children succeed.

Danny joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Danny has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Danny is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Juditha

texts.en:
Ma. Juditha V. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 50 years old. Ma. Juditha is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Ma. Juditha raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ma. Juditha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to culture oysters. 

Ma. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby piglets and pig feed. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Ma. Juditha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Lydia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Monserrate es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus amigas son muy unidas. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y la última de 17 años de edad la misma que este año empieza a estudiar en Universidad, dos de sus hijos viven en su casa.  Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Ella se dedica a lavar ropa ajena pero también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja los fines de semana  desde las 9h00 hasta las 13h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho  días, cobra  y al mismo momento realiza nuevas ventas. Su mercadería la compra en  Guayaquil y nos cuenta que lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y que con esto ha podido ayudar a su hija para que siga con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es ver que su hija termine sus estudios y  que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Esperanza y Progreso' (Hope and Progress) community bank meets in Montecristi canton.  This area is known both nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Monserrate is a founding member of the community bank and she likes being a member because her friends are all very united.  Monserrate is 48 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of her children are grown up and her youngest daughter is 17.  This year she will start University.  Two of Monserrate's children still live at home.  Her husband is a master builder.

Monserrate washes other people's clothes but she is also a saleswoman.  She sells all types of clothes and makes her sales door to door.  She works on weekends, from 9.00am to 1.00pm, leaving her goods with her customers on credit.  She collects payment every week and, at the same time, makes new sales.  Monserrate buys her merchandise in Guayaquil.  She tells us that she has been in this business for three years and it has enabled her to help her daughter continue with her studies.

Monserrate will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia C. is 56 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. She is from Manila Group barangay in the municipality of Wao, Lanao del Sur province on the Mindano islands. Alicia operates a store where she sells primarily vegetables and spices like ginger, onions and garlic to the local community. Alicia has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Alicia successfully repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and gain some working capital.

Alicia is requesting a new loan, her fifth from HSPFI, of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like cabbages, eggplants and red bell peppers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables like cabbages, eggplants and red bell peppers

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 32 years old and is married, with three children between 4 and 8 years old. Evariste works as a motorcycle driver. He has had his business for four years . His business is well-organized and he currently employs one person to help him. He opens his business from 6am to 10pm every day.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance company, in order to expand his business by purchasing a new motorcycle. With a profit, he will be able to build his own house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Miguel Eusebio

texts.es:
Miguel de 57 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Esta casado y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y todos le ayudan en su taller de carpintería.

Empezó desde muy pequeño, el confeccionaba sus carritos de juguete en madera para jugar, ningún familiar se dedicaba a la carpintería, el tuvo que aprender por medio de unos amigos. Lo mantiene con ayuda de su esposa e hijos, empieza desde las 8H00 am a 8H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar madera y herramientas para su negocio y así incrementar su capital. En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio o comprar un solar para abrir solo para su taller y tener una vida sana y tranquila con su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 57 years old, and lives in a semi urban area in the Perimetral of Guayaquil (a very humble place, the houses of the area are surrounded by an estuary where freight boats pass with heavy loads). He is married and has 4 children who are adults and all help him in his carpenter’s workshop.

Miguel started his work from a very young age; he made his own toy cars out of wood to play with, he didn’t have a family member who was a carpenter and he had to learn through a friend. He keeps his workshop with his wife’s and children’s help, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With the loan he will buy lumber and tools for his business to increase his capital. In the future he hopes to expand his business or to buy a lot to open a workshop and have a healthy and peaceful life with his family.

loans.use: buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun lives in Kompong Cham where she and her husband earn about $3 a day by growing rice and potatoes. The couple has four children, one of whom is a driver for a loan company while the other three are still in school.  Mrs. Oun is applying for a loan to help pay for the cost of planting her new potato crop.

loans.use: plant her new potato crop

loans.name: Mévi

texts.fr: En 2005, Mme Mévi  a commencé par  vendre des produits génériques au marché d’Agoé et  à domicile. Mère d’01 enfant, elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant plus de stock au Grand marché de Lomé. Son conjoint est cordonnier et il veut assurer son devoir de femme au foyer.
texts.en: In 2005, Mevi began selling generic health products at the market in Agoè and from her home. Mother of one child, she wants to strengthen her business by buying more stock at the Grand Market in Lomé. Her husband is a shoemaker and he wants to ensure she can perform her duties as housewife.

loans.use: to buy generic health products

loans.name: Forward Ever Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Forward Ever” group from Waterloo, a small town near the capital city, Freetown. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kumba. Kumba was born in the eastern city of Kono, 34 years ago. She is married, with 5 children. Two are in primary school and three in secondary school.  Kumba sells fish and has been running this business for 11 years. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to add to her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children to university level. Stella is a director of a primary school and has been in this service for 3 years.

The major obstacle Stella encounters is too little capital to buy scholastic materials and too few classrooms to cater to the increasing number of pupils. Stella intends to use the loan she has requested to buy materials for construction, in order to build a block of classrooms.

loans.use: To bulid a classroom block.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs.Yi and her husband have been married just a few years, and both work planting crops.  Yi is requesting a loan for $500 to purchase land upon which they hope to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Romulino

texts.en:
Romulino is 46 years old. He is a single man dealing with his 2 grown children. The family is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. While not the only means of income, Romulino has engaged in raising domestic animals - swine, in particular. He has been feeding, cleaning and taking good care of these animals for 2 years. He sells the grown ones to swine buyers for a good price. Every month, he normally receives about PHP 22,920.

Earlier this year, Romulino joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from the organization to purchase swine for fattening and materials to repair their shelter.  Romulino hopes to sell the current raised pigs at a higher price and have more piglets to grow later.

loans.use: To purchase swine for fattening and materials to repair their shelter.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, vive con su hija de 27 de años, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, todos los días realiza las ventas, en el mercado municipal, por las noches hace tortillas.
Este negocio le permite obtener los ingresos para sus necesidades, ella quiere hacer unos cambios en su puesto de venta, para ello invertirá en compra arena y cemento, pues su objetivo es tener un lugar mejor establecido, donde los clientes estén más cómodos y satisfechos con el servicio.
El sueño de Mercedes es algún día comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her 27-year-old daughter. She sells tortillas and “pupusas”. Mercedes sells her products every day at the municipal market. At night she makes tortillas.

This business has allowed her to generate income to pay for her necessities. Mercedes wants to make a few changes to her vending stall, so she will invest in the purchase of sand and cement with the intent of having a better established location so that her customers will be more comfortable and satisfied with her service.

Mercedes dreams of someday having her own home.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for remodeling the premises of her business.

loans.name: Manuel Agustín

texts.es: Este cliente se dedica al aseo de calles del municipio de san Rafael del sur, ya tiene más de quince años de laborar en esta actividad, es padre de cinco hijos uno de menor edad, solicita crédito para mejora de vivienda, actualmente es dueño de su casa es casado y agradece la labor que hacen estas instituciones para las personas de bajos ingresos.
texts.en:
This client is a street sweeper for the city of San Rafael del Sur. He has been in this job for more than 15 years. He is the father of five children, one of whom is a dependent.

He is requesting a loan to make improvements to the house that he currently owns. He is married and appreciates the work being done by organizations that help low-income people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a single man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, Juma has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. Juma dreams of succeeding in business and living a better life. 
With this loan of 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents. He decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel currently owns a retail shop, which he has run since 2009. He also keeps two dairy cows and runs a bicycle repair stall. He lives in Malindi town of Coast Province. He is married and has four children, two of whom are now independent. The third born is starting college in February, 2012, and the last born is in class 6. He got the idea for his business thinking about the fact that people have to travel a long way to Malindi town to buy retail stock. He joined Milango in late 2010 and has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings which will help him purchase retail stock, e.g., sugar, flour, milk, fat, soap, etc. 

Gabriel intends to buy more dairy cows and become an established dairy farmer. He also plans to build rental houses on his expansive piece of land in the future. The great challenge he faces is lack of capital. This loan will increase his disposable income to educate his daughter in college and to buy a solar lamp in the short term. Gabriel advises his colleagues to use microfinance to access credit and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy retail stock, e.g., flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Papanggo Merdeka 1 Group

texts.en:
Entin is 46 years old and married with three children. She is pictured in the middle wearing the white shirt. Her business is selling clothes on credit and she has been doing this for four years. Her business is doing well but she wants to take the loan to increase her customer base by having more inventory. She sells clothing door-to-door around her neighborhood.

She uses the income from her business to help pay the school fees for her children. Her hopes for the future are that her children will have the education to get a better job that she has had.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell on credit.

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Buen Progreso está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadora y emprendedora. Una de ellas es Blanca  quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas en especial tamarindos este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años en el mercado.
Las otras integrantes son Olga de la Cruz quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y nacatamales desde hace 15 años y Miriam vende cosméticos y perfumes.
texts.en: The 'Buen Progreso' (Good Progress) group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Blanca who buys and sells harvested crops, especially tamarind. She started this business 8 years ago in the market. The other members of the group are Olga de la Cruz who has been slaughtering pigs and selling nacatamales for 15 years and Miriam who sells cosmetics and perfume.

loans.use: to buy tamarind

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith tiene 49 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amable. Vive en compañía de su esposo y de sus dos menores hijos, por quienes desea ella salir adelante y brindarle una adecuada educación. Los trabajos que realiza Sadith consiste en la venta de ropa a crédito, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima, pues es ahí donde hay mayor variedad y calidad de prendas. Asimismo se dedica a la costura y remendar una que otro ropa de sus clientes. Éste último oficio lo aprendió en un centro ocupacional. Es así que su día laboral empieza con el componer alguna prenda, o confeccionar, ya en la tarde se dedica a vender ropa. En ocasiones cuando necesita de más ingresos, ofrece el servicio de preparar tortas, esto de acuerdo al pedido que le hace sus clientes. Tiene tres años trabajando de esta manera, y en todo este tiempo siempre ha tenido la ayuda incondicional de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que se mantiene ocupada y le genera un ingreso económico que le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo, el dejar a crédito la ropa que vende, solo recupera un porcentaje, pues muchos de sus clientes se demoran en pagar. Su mayor anhelo es crecer su negocio y montar una tienda. Este sería el primer credito con MFP, pro tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el dinero recibido lo invertirá en la compra de ropa al por mayor en diversos modelos.
texts.en:
Sadith, 49, is an enterprising, very kind woman.  She lives with her husband and two minor children that she wants to get ahead for and provide an adequate education to.  The work Sadith does is selling clothes on credit, products she brings from the city of Lima because that’s where the greatest variety and best quality clothes are.  

She’s also a seamstress and works repairing one or another article of clothing for her customers.  This latter occupation she learned at an occupational center.  Thus her work day may start with her repairing a piece of clothing or in making an item since the afternoons are spent selling clothes.  Occasionally when she needs to earn extra income she bakes cakes on order for her customers.  She’s been working this way for three years and has had her husband’s unconditional support all this time. 

What she likes about her work is that it keeps her busy and generates income that allows her to cover household expenses and her children’s education.  However, selling her clothes on credit sometimes means only a percentage profit because sometimes her customers take their time to pay her back.  Her greatest wish is to make her business grow and to open a store.

This would be her first MFP loan so she’s hoping for support from all of you.  She will use the money she gets to buy assorted clothes in diverse styles at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Román, de 67 años es un hombre solitario. Vive en casa de su sobrino, ubicada en el asentamiento humano Juan Parra del Riego. Sus días se centran en hacer progresar su negocio. Su principal soporte económico es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó en la casa donde vive. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es surtir su tienda con productos nuevos. Cuenta que incorporó hace poco variedades de frutas, verduras, carnes y condimentos con lo que obtuvo más clientes. Por ahora espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar la calidad de atención para tener clientes fieles que compren sus alimentos en su tienda, pues hay muchos como él en su zona.  Este es el décimosegundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Román de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de panetones de diversas marcas y tamaños, así también chocolates y leche para está temporada de navidad.
texts.en:
Román is 67 years old and a solitary man. He lives in his nephew's house which is located in the settlement of Juan Parra del Riego. His days are focused on making progress with his business. His economic mainstay is selling staple products from a fitted-out area in the house where he lives. He has 5 years of experience and what he likes the most is stocking his store with new products. He tells us that a short time ago he introduced different types of fruit, vegetables, meats and seasonings with which he attracted more clients. For now he hopes to grow the business more and improve the quality of service in order to have loyal customers that buy their food from his store as there are plenty of other stores like his in the area. This is his 12th loan with MFP and he hopes to have your support so as to realize his plans. On the other hand he promises to make his repayments, as he did with the previous loans. In addition he likes being a part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive. 

Román, with your support, will invest the money requested to buy panetones of different brands and sizes, as well as chocolates and milk for the coming Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy panetones, chocolates and milk for the Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: Largo Filomena Group

texts.en:
Filomena is married and has 5 children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Filomena has been a farmer for 5 years, growing corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation. Filomena has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

Filomena is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John Jairo tiene 22 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.

John se dedica a la las actividades de albañil, comercio, ganadería, agricultor. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado) y la alimentación. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá ayudarse ha mejorar la economía de la familia.

El sueño es tener una casa grande de 3 pisos tener un negocio grande, viajar por otro país.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
John Jairo is 22 years old, married, and has no children.  He and his wife live in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

John is a member is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income. 

John is a bricklayer, merchant, livestock breeder, and farmer.  He buys and sells in Guaranda.  John is requesting a loan to buy animals (livestock) and feed.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve his family’s finances.  His dreams include having a large house with three stories, owning a large business, and traveling to another country.

In his free time, John enjoys the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 32 años y vive con su familia en la provincia de "Cotopaxi" en Latacunga, que es la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Quito. Es una acogedora ciudad, que con su catedral y la Iglesia de San Francisco muestra la belleza del arte religioso, ambientadas con estrechas calles adoquinadas, resaltadas por los vivos colores de las típicas fachadas de sus viviendas y el polvoriento paisaje circundante. Latacunga viene de dos voces quichuas llacata kunka que significa Dios de las Lagunas. Cuando llega noviembre sus empedradas calles se llenan de alegría por la celebración de la fiesta en honor a la Virgen de las Mercedes, se trata de la ceremonia de la “Mama Negra”, que simboliza la fertilidad y la productividad de la tierra.

Ana tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de tejas de barro, las mismas que son usadas para cubrir los techos de las casas; además también realiza artesanías del mismo material. Traja diariamente un promedio de diez horas. Este negocio es muy duro y de alto riesgo ya que quien trabaja en ello está expuesto a la contaminación con plomo. Aprendió este oficio desde hace varios años por enseñanza de un familiar. Se considera una mujer trabajadora con ganas de crecer y por ello ha encontrado en el crédito una herramienta para poder cumplir sus metas y realizar sus sueños que son el ampliar su negocio y con ello percibir mayores ingresos y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her family in the province of Cotopaxi in Latacunga, the capital of the province, located an hour and a half from the city of Quito.  It is a friendly city that shows the beauty of religious art with its cathedral and the Iglesia de San Francisco, livened up with narrow cobbled streets highlighted by the vivid colors of the facades of the homes and the dusty surrounding landscape.

Latacunga comes from two Quechua words, "llacata" and "kunka," 'Dios de las Lagunas' [God of the Lagoons].  When November arrives, the paved streets fill with happiness for the celebration of the Virgen de las Mercedes, or the ceremony of the Mama Negra, who symbolizes fertility and the productivity of the land.

Ana has a business making and selling clay tiles, the same ones that are used to cover the roofs of houses.  She also makes crafts of the same material.  She works an average of 10 hours a day.  This is a very hard and high-risk business because anyone who works in it is exposed to lead poisoning.  She learned this job several years ago through the instruction of a relative.

She considers herself a hard-working woman who wants to grow, so she has found the loan to buy a tool to be able to achieve her goals and realize her dream.  She wants to expand her business and have a bigger income and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: para expandir su negocio

loans.name: Lucy R

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Lucy from Chitungwiza. She is married with three children, all attending school. Lucy runs an agricultural business raising poultry. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are the high mortality rate and thieves. Lucy has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicks and feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Lucy plans to expand the chicken runs so that she can sell 3000 birds per month.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feeds

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
