Le groupe Badenya, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de condiments et de savon                                                                                                                                                                                                  
La cliente1 CHITAN, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des condiments (un panier de piment, une dizaine de  paquets de cube Maggi, 2 paniers d’aubergine et 3 paniers de tomate fraîche) avec les revendeurs de Marka-Coungo pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison et au marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.

loans.use: Achat de condiments

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 29 year-old mother of three children. She describes herself as honest. She is involved in the selling of second hand clothes and has been running this business for two years.  The market environment is busy and most of her customers come from various areas. She is applying for a loan of kes 30,000 which will be used to purchase cloth sheet,needles and threads for sewing clothes in her tailoring business. This is her 2nd application for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cloth sheet,needles and threads for sewing clothes in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nat Isl Pri Bandajum Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of a secondary school, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL 10,800,000.00. They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Lawrence is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place called Njiehun, in eastern Sierra Leone, the 52 years old is married to a house-wife and has 7 children.  Three are in secondary school and four in college. Mohamed has been a professional school teacher for 35 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Violet, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 31 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.  She is married and has 4 children.

Violet is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to earn enough to send her children to school, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Violet says that she is happy to have made that decision.  Since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Violet will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres. 
Some members of the group will also be purchasing 8 solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old, married with five children. She is very active in women affairs and the group decided to elect her to the post of chairlady. Nancy attended secondary education and this has helped her in directing other women.

Nancy started her business two years ago with USD 100 and it has been improving day-by- day. The business has grown to the tune of about USD 900 and continues to grow further. This business enables her to support the family in all household requirements and believes that she will be financially stable in two years to come.

loans.use: Nancy operates a retail shop that sells a number of household items. The population in Olturoto Trading centre has been growing as well as the demand of house hold items such as sugar, maize flour, rice, soap, salt and many more. Therefore, she wants to increase her stock of these items to match wit

loans.name: Badam Gul

texts.en:
Badam Gul is 40 years old, a mother of 6 children, and lives in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan

Badam Gul took a loan for her husband who has a fresh fruits and vegetable shop in the market.

Badam Gul cleans and categorizes the fruits and then her husband sells them in the bazaar. She hopes to receive another loan from AFSG so that she can buy more vegetables and fruits for her husband's shop.

loans.use: To buy fresh apples, bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Mrs Loi and her husband are old but she has to support her husband and son, Thien. Loi's husband has high blood pressure and Thien is retarded. They don't have any land. Mrs Loi has to work as a day laborer but the work is not stable so she has to raise pigs at home.  Raising pigs is thus important for them and improve their income by $1.5/person/month from their average income of $10/person/month. Now she needs a loan of $75.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Maria Artiles

texts.en:
Maria A. lives with Manuel Hidalgo in the community of Munoz and runs a small grocery store that she calls Cafateria Artile. This $150 loan will go to purchase refrigerated goods such as meat, dairy products and beverages. She has already paid off a previous loan with Esperanza and has gone through business training courses to help her develop her microenterprise.

Maria is a member of an Esperanza Bank of Hope in Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. Though living in an impoverished community, Maria’s group of women forms a strong bond to hold one another accountable to repay their loan and develop their business while offering social support.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerated goods

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
My name is Parveen B. and I live in Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city. I have five children—three boys and two girls. All three of my sons currently work as sales assistants. They were not able to complete their studies because of our poor financial condition. I hope the same fate does not befall my daughters, who look forward to going to school every morning.

A couple of years ago I took out a small loan and started a seasonal cloth-selling business. I buy shawls and tailoring fabric from a wholesale market and then sell it door-to-door in the surrounding neighborhoods. This is a very profitable business for me and does not take up too much time either, which means my household duties are not neglected. I would now like to expand my business and do it year-round and seek a loan to help me. I will sell these clothes in the local market or neighborhood.

Parveen B., Lahore.

loans.use: To buy clothes from local market in Lahore and sell them in my neighbourhood.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos O. is an Acholi by tribe. He came to Kampala from the Pader districts of Northern Uganda due to wars in the region making it unsafe to stay in his village. From the northern region, he settled in Banda Acholi Quarters in Kampala where he started working in the stone quarry. He later was brought by his friend to join Life in Africa Foundation and started making paper beads and also got a job as a security guard. According to him, his life has changed for the better.

Amos’s stone quarry is now in high demand. There is a lot of construction and renovation in Kampala and the gravel needs are large. So he wants to double his profits by making more trips. He used to make 90,000/= (about US$50) in profit from two trips per month, and now he is requesting a loan of 250,000/= (US$150) to expand his business to four trips per month. He feels sure he will be able to repay this loan in 3 months.

Below is his budget:

-Extraction ……………………. 90,000/=

-Breaking ………………………30,000/=

-Carrying out of the pit…………40,000/=

-Crouching to aggregates ……….90, 000/=

Total …………………………….250, 000/=

loans.use: Employing laborers

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás is twenty-eight years old and lives as a couple with Maria Dávalos, who is twenty-five years old, and they both own their own house already.

Tomás began to work when he was very young with his uncle as a travelling salesman. Later with some savings he bought a motorcycle and became independent. Ten years have already gone by since then and he tells others very proudly that sales are going well for him.

He makes his sales house to house, going about on his motorcycle some kilometers each day. He sells sheets, towels, t-shirts, skirts, table cloths, articles for the home, etc. His two brothers and his cousin work with him, who he pays with a commission for their sales.

He needs a loan to buy a motorcylce with a cart to carry his merchandise, so that he can carry a greater quantity and be much more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tomás tiene 28 años de edad, vive en pareja con Maria Dávalos de 25 años de edad y ambos ya poseen casa propia.

Tomás empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su tío como vendedor ambulante, luego de juntar unos ahorros compro una moto y se independizó; ya van diez años de que ese entonces y cuenta muy orgulloso que le va muy bien con las ventas.

Realiza las ventas casa por casa, recorriendo con su moto varios kilómetros diarios. Vende sábanas, toallas, remeras, faldas, ollas, cubiertos, artículos para el hogar, etc. Con él trabajan dos de sus hermanos y un primo a quienes les paga una comisión por las ventas realizadas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta con carrito para poder llevar sus mercaderías, de este modo podrá llevar mayor cantidad y mucho más cómodo.

loans.use: Buy a motorcylce with a cart

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José M. is a native of the city of León in Nicaragua. He emigrated to Managua in search of a better life and established himself in the neighborhood known as 3-80, a very poor neighborhood in need of road and sewage infrastructure. José is 50 year old and married with 3 children. To be able to feed his family and give an education to his children, he started a small business selling basic grains. He has developed his business over time, and now has a general store where he sells everything from basic grains to clothes. He needs the loan to be able to buy school supplies and shoes. This purchase will prepare him for the school season in Nicaragua, and satisfy the demand of this neighbor in the neighborhood 3-80.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

José M. es originario de la Ciudad de León, Nicaragua. En busca de una mejor vida emigró Managua donde se estableció en el barrio 3-80, un barrio muy pobre y necesitado de mucha infraestructura vial y desagüe. Don José tiene 50 años de edad, casado y con tres niños. Empezó con un pequeño negocio de ventas de granos básicos para poder alimentar a su familia y darle educación a sus hijos. Ha venido desarrollandose, siendo ahora una Miscelanea donde vende desde granos básicos hasta ropa. Necesita el crédito para comprar útiles escolares y zapatos para poder recibir la época escolar en Nicaragua, y satisfacer la demanda de todos sus vecinos en el barrio 3-80.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and shoes

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel belongs to the New Horizon Community Bank, located at the #2 Market of the Calleria District, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and has 5 young children. She is married and her husband is a merchant. With her first loan of 300 soles(Peruvian currency) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in implementing a vegetable stand.

Currently, she continues selling vegetables. She wakes up at 4 am. to open her stand at the farmers' market until 3pm. then she goes home to rest and start over again the next day.

With the 1,800 soles loan, which she promises to pay back in 5 months, Ysabel will but 5 boxes of pannetonne, 5 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of chocolates, 3 sacks of potatoes, 2 sacks of onions and a variety of vegetables.

Ysabel is very happy because the Manuela Ramos organizations is a great support for her. She feels like she is progressing in all aspects of her life

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ysabel pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Horizonte, ubicado en el Mercado Nº 2 del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 5 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la implementación de un negocio de venta de verduras. En la actualidad ella continúa con la venta de verduras. Se levanta a las 4 am. para abrir su puesto de venta en el mercado hasta las 3 p.m., luego se dirige a descansar para su rutina del día siguiente. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagará en 5 meses, comparará 5 cajas de panetones, 5 cajas de leche, 5 cajas de chocolates, 3 sacos de papa, 2 sacos de cebollas y variedad de verduras. Ysabel se siente muy feliz porque Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo, también se siente que está progresando en todos los aspectos de su vida.

loans.use: Buying vegetables and others like: milk, chocolates, etc to sell at her business

loans.name: Koku's Subira Group

texts.en:
Koku A., age 29, is married and has 2 children (ages 6 and 12). She has a cake shop which she began 3 years ago. She works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily, and she has managed to make a monthly profit of around US$131.

Koku has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy equipment for making cakes. She hopes for a new loan to buy umbrellas for customers to sit under outside the café. Koku will share this loan with her subgroup members, who deal in selling charcoal, alcohol and soft drinks, food, hardware, and poultry.

In the picture Koku is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To purchase umbrellas for her cake shop

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim T., 37, is married with nine children and stays at home with them and cooks food for her entire family. Her husband has a business recharging batteries by using a generator. In rural areas, people depend on these batteries to power their lights, televisions, etc. He earns around three dollars a day. One son and one daughter are souvenir vendors at Siem Reap province, earning around $50 each per month. The other children attend school and also help their parents.

To raise the family’s income, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to purchase a grinding mill. The machine will be for her personal use but she will also rent it to other villagers who want to take husks off rice. This will give the family more income and allow them to save money. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Sim T. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Aboke Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Joseph O. is a young Kenyan father, aged 30, with 6 children.  He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late sister who passed away 2 years ago.

Joseph started his business 4 years ago after accumulating savings from his former workplace in a local hospital in Kisumu town.  He currently operates a small retail cereals business of maize, rice, and green grams (mung beans) that he sells to his customers in the neighborhood.  

Being the sole breadwinner for his family, Joseph has to support his children and his wife, who has a low-paying job.  With the little profit that he gets from the business, Joseph still struggles to feed,
clothe, and educate his children and to pay his house rent.  With the help of his loan, Joseph will be able to purchase more bags of different grains to enable him to increase his sales.  He also hopes to open up a cereal wholesale unit from the business profits.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchasing grains in bulk

loans.name: Bebey

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bebey A. was born in 1983 in Gamé séva (Zio County). Lacking financial means, she left school and went into the preparation and sale of palm oil. The income from this business allows her to contribute to household expenses. Married and the mother of one child, she is dynamic and well versed in her business. In order to increase her income, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy larger quantities of palm nuts to prepare oil so that she can better satisfy her clientele. This will allow her to increase her income and better contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Bebey est née en 1983 à Gamé séva (P/Zio). Par manque de moyens, elle a abandonné ses études et s’est lancée dans la préparation et la vente de l’huile de palm. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettent de contribuer aux charges du foyer. Mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant, elle est dynamique et maîtrise bien son activité. Pour accroître son revenu, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter en grande quantité les noix de palme pour la préparation de l’huile afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil

Achat de noix de palme pour préparation d'huile rouge

loans.name: Vich

texts.en: Mrs. Vich L. is a vegetable farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 32 year old mother of three: two of whom are attending school, while another is too young to work or study. Lately, her vegetables have been continually destroyed by roaming poultry and cattle; thus, Mrs. Vich L. has decided to ask for a loan to build a fence to protect her crop from poultry and cattle. Her husband, Mr. Mao Bun is a construction worker who earns a small income.  Previously, Mrs. Vich L. obtained a loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.use: To build a fence to protect crop from poultry and cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to keep producing delicious pastelitos.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia G. cooks and sells fries out of her home. Antonia does everything by hand, and she hopes to improve her working conditions. Five years ago, when she started her business, her sister helped her, since she only had a part-time job.
Now, Antonia is requesting a loan to buy a commercial kitchen that will allow her to cook more efficiently, and to serve more customers.
Antonia, 39, is a single mother of three children; two of them work to help their mother and to pay for college.
Antonia's wish is to support her family and offer them a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Antonia G. es comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de frituras, elabora papas fritas y las vende en su casa de habitación. Antonia realiza sus frituras de manera artesanal y sus planes son poder mejorar su forma de trabajo. Inició el préstamo hace 5 años, su hermana le ayudaba en la elaboración de las frituras ya que trabajaba solamente medio tiempo. El préstamo solicitado será para la compra de una cocina industrial que le permita facilidad y rapidez en sus ventas y así atender a más clientes. Antonia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales dos trabajan para apoyar a su madre y pagar sus estudios universitarios. Espera poder sacar adelante a su familia adelante y darles una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of commercial kitchen to improve sales

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La  señora Grimaldina  Z.  tiene 54 años y vive en la calle José Olaya 105 donD. también funciona su negocio, en el distrito D. Mache en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento D. La Libertad.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no siguió estudiando debido a que solamente había primaria en el distrito, además los padres preferían darles educación  completa a los hijos varones.
Grimaldina es madre soltera, tiene un hijo al cual educa y cuida completamente sola, pero ella es una mujer muy valiente.
Cuenta con una bodega donD. venD. golosinas, cerveza y comida.
Con Manuela Ramos obtuvo su primer préstamo D. 300 soles que le fueron D. muchísima utilidad, ya que con eso compro víveres para hacer comida y darles pensión a los profesores que en ese tiempo no tenían donD. comer, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos televisores e instalará una sala D. juego D. nintendo.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular D. su barrio y al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo, ella es la presidenta.
Su gran sueño es poner cabinas D. Internet y hacer que su Mache avance cada día más.
texts.en:
Grimaldina Z. is 54 years old and lives at 105 Jose Olaya Street where she also runs her business, in the Mache district, in the Otuzco province, in the Libertad department.

She completed elementary school, however she did not continue her studies as elementary school was only available in her area. In addition, parents preferred to educate male children completely.

Grimaldina is a single mother. She has a son who she took care of and educated completely on her own. She is a very brave woman.

She has a shop where she sells candy, beer and food. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles through Manuela Ramos. It was very useful since with it she purchased food to make meals and gave pensions to teachers who, at that time, had nowhere to eat. She repaid her loan in four months.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy televisions and install a Nintendo game room.

She belongs to the Comedor Popular (soup kitchen) in her neighborhood and she is the president of the Working Women Community Bank.

Her greatest dream is to install Internet stalls and ensure that Mache advances every day.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two televisions.

loans.name: Slađana

texts.en:
Slađana is 38 and lives in Bijeljina, a rapidly-expanding town in northeast Bosnia. She is not married. She works in a hair salon, where she sells cosmetics and offers make-overs to clients.

Slađana requests a 600 KM loan from Women for Women International so that she can buy additional cosmetics to attract more customers. This is her first loan request.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to attract new customers.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. Donata has a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho, and also has a plot of land with her family where they cultivate potatoes, broadbeans, quinoa and corn. She splits her time between the restaurant and her farm, working three days per week at each one. She also sells meals at a market near her farm in the country, where she serves traditional Peruvian meals like meat and beans, chicken soup, and “puka picante” (a spicy blend of fried pork and vegetables).

At her restaurant, Donata sells set lunches and side dishes. Her specialties are trout and “mondongo” (a traditional Peruvian dish made with cow’s belly), and her prices vary according to her customers’ preferences—they can buy one sol, two soles or three soles (33, 66 or 99 cents) worth of food. Sunday is her busiest day; she often serves mondongo to as many as 40 people. Donata has temporarily closed the restaurant for potato planting season, but plans to open again after she’s finished. 

Donata is requesting a loan of 2000 soles, half of which she will use to buy bulk ingredients for her restaurant, and the other half of which will go towards installing a large front door in her home. She is a long-time customer of FINCA Peru, and has been working with the institution for five or six years. 

In the future, Donata would like to start baking and selling pastries at her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients; home construction

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Ángeles tiene ya mas de trece años dedicándose a polarizar los cristales de los automóviles este es su negocio y el ingreso de su familia.
A el se le  presento una oportunidad de comprar el material por mayoreo en la ciudad de Monterrey, México. Pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacer la compra de inmediato.
Esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder obtener esa oferta que se le esta presentando en este momento. Esto le permitirá comprar la mercancía a un precio bajo y no tendrá que viajar frecuentemente para realizar la compra de ese producto.
texts.en:
Sergio A. has thirteen years of experience working with tinted car windows. This is his job and how he earns money for his family. He has an opportunity to buy materials at a wholesale price in Monterrey, Mexico, but he does not have the money to purchase the materials right now. He is asking for a loan to be able to take advantage of this opportunity. This loan will allow him to buy the materials at a low price and he will not have to travel frequently in order to buy this product.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia D. A. M. has a general goods store in the “No. 2” Market in Pucallpa, Peru.  Alicia is fifty-seven years old and has five children with her husband who is a gas station attendant.  Alicia has been a member of the Talented Women communal bank for six years and uses the capital from her loans to support her business.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 1,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase stock for her market stall.  She will buy electrical wiring, outlets, and fixtures in addition to machetes and tools.  Alicia will repay her loan in four monthly installments.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wiring, outlets, and fixtures in addition to machetes and tools

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.en:
Anorbi K. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. She lives in Dushanbe and owns a small store in the local market. Anorbi has been selling kids' clothing for about 3 years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted kids' clothing at affordable prices. Her profit from the business has increased extensively since she started her business.

Anorbi has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 9 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Clavelitos De Padcaya Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “ Clavelitos D. Padcaya” representados por la señora Maria Estela se dedican a sus propios pequeños negocios como pensión D. comida, tiendas  D. barrio, librería, panaderías, venta D. cosméticos por catálogos y al trasporte publico, el financiamiento esta destinado al incremento D. capital para ampliar sus negocios y a la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. Existe un parentesco dentro D. grupo que son la señora teresa y su hija  Raquel ambas tienen ingresos independientes por lo no estén problemas dentro del grupo. Van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y muchas ganas seguir adelante tienen antecedentes crediticios impecables y son gente muy trabajadora. En el momento D. la fotografia el señor juan renato no asistio y mando a su esposa.
texts.en:
The members of the “Clavelitos D. Padcaya” group, represented by Ms. Maria Estela, are all dedicated to their own small businesses such as food sales, neighborhood markets, a bookstore, bakeries, catalog cosmetics sales, and public transportation. This loan will be used to increase capital to expand their businesses and purchase the supplies needed to increase their income and improve the quality of life of their families. Two of the group members are related: Teresa and her daughter Raquel. They each have their own income, so there are not any problems within the group. They are all currently in the second loan cycle, demonstrating responsibility and the desire to get ahead in life. They are very hard-working people who have impeccable credit history. At the time that this picture was taken, Mr. Juan Renato was not able to attend, so he sent his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Utari

texts.id: Sebagai Ibu Rumah tangga Dewa Ayu Utari sangat tekun bekerja, Utari menjual lauk pauk berkeliling dari rumah kerumah dan juga keliling dipasar Melaya.Dengan modal awal Rp.2.000.000 Utari membeli bahan-bahan untuk lauk pauk dan juga sayur-sayuran .Jenis lauk pauk seperti sate babi,sate laut,ikan pepes pindang,tribang ,lemuru, sayur sayuran seperti srombotan klungkung,sayur urap dan plecing kangkung. Utari bangun pagi-pagi jam 4 pagi sudah berangkat kepasar melaya untuk membeli bahan-bahan yang akan dimasak .Sampai dirumah Utari sudah mulai masak beraneka macam masakan ,Utari dibantu oleh suaminya menantunya dan juga mertuanya.Pukul 12 siang Utari sudah mulai berkeliling untuk menjajakan dagangannya sampai habis,karena masakannya enak-enak dagangannya Utari tidak pernah tersisa bahkan sering ada yang tidak kebagian.Keuntungan yang diperoleh kira-kira Rp.80.000,keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya karena anak-anaknya sudah semua tamat SMA dan tidak melanjutkan lagi karena tidak punya cukup biaya untuk melanjutkan keuniversitas. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah   modal usahanya.
texts.en:
As a housewife, Dewa Ayu Utari, is a diligent worker, she sells variety dishes around her house from house-to-house and also besides the Malay market. With an early funding of Rp.2.000.000 Utari buys ingredients for the variety side dishes and also vegetables. Variety dishes like pork satay, seafood satay, grilled preserved fish, and a variety of vegetables. Utari wakes up early by 4 am already headed to the Malay market to buy ingredients, which need to be cooked. Returning home, she immediately commences cooking several types of dishes. Her husband and in-laws assist Utari. By 12 noon, Utari already started her rounds peddling her merchandise until they are all sold, as her cooking is delicious thus no leftover merchandise even frequently some are insufficient to distribute. Profit earned approximately Rp.80.000, this profit will be used for fulfill their needs as the children completed high school and did not continue schooling due to inability to pay for university education. Their home built on land they owned is adequately permanent. She hopes to use this loan from Dinari as additional funding for the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou C. est mariée et membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Palal. Son activité est la vente de fruits locaux et l’embouche. Elle veut relancer son commerce de fruits. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou C. is married and is a member of the village loan group of Bayouf Palal. Her business involves selling local fruit and pasture fattening of livestock. She would like to boost her fruit-selling business. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S. is managing a one-hectare rice farm. She is 35 years old and has five children. Her husband, Danilo S., is helping her with the farm business. They have been together for two years already. Farming is their only source of income. Aside from rice, the family also grows vegetables in their backyard to supplement their income.

Now, Arlene is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI (the first Filipino MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil fertility of her farm, and herbicides to stop insects and pests from inflicting damage on her crops. In this way, she believes, her family will get a better yield than their previous experience.

CEVI is reaching out more farmers to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI is provides their clients with credit, trainings and insurance coverage services to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos Chávez tiene 33 años y está casado con la señora Cinthia González que tiene 22 años de edad. Ambos son padres de dos hijos; una nena de 8 años que sea grande quiere ser enfermera y un varón de 1 año que a su padre le gustaría que sea un respetable abogado.

 El cliente era empleado de un Comercial denominado Deposito El sol, y con un pequeño ahorro inició hace 8 años su propia microempresa, que consiste en la venta de artículos de bazar y mercería. Más adelante tiene pensado tener un local propio, para la venta ya que cuenta con clientela formada. Su esposa también lo ayuda en el negocio.

 El dinero del préstamo será destinado a la compra de remeras y blusas para volver a venderlo.

Desea un país con mayor seguridad y que mejore la situación económica.
texts.en:
Carlos Chávez is 33 years old and married to Cinthia González, who is 22 years old. They have two children, a girl who is 8 years old and wants to be a nurse, and a boy who is 1 year old, who Carlos hopes will be a respectable lawyer.

Carlos was employed by a company called Deposito El Sol, and with a small savings started his own small business 8 years ago, selling clothing. In the future, he hopes to have his own store, as he already has a client base. His wife also helps with the business.

This loan will be used to purchase tshirts and blouses to be sold.

Carlos would like a safer country, and an improved economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Pun Maiya

texts.en:
Pun Maiya M. lives in a single family in Patan. She has five members including herself in her family. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter has already got married and her younger daughter is studying in BBS level. Her son is working in a private office.

Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are farmers and they grow seasonal vegetables in her land due to lack modern tools and equipment. They especially grow green vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily.

Now she is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda es una mujer de 40 años, sencilla y trabajadora; es madre de dos niños, Miguel de 12 y Rubén de 8 años. Actualmente vive en su casa propia hecha de adobe y desea salir adelante. En el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), tiene un pequeño lugar donde vende su deliciosa comida, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a las personas, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todas las porciones preparadas. Tiene 15 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea implementar un restaurante para vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. A Imelda le gusta conversar con sus comensales, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto al mismo tiempo; pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es su primer préstamo co MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo para no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetuosa con sus demás compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar la comida que vende y así podrá preparar más porciones al día.
texts.en:
Imelda is a 40 year old woman, unassuming and hardworking. She is the mother of 2 sons – Miguel, 12 years old, and Ruben who is 8. She lives in her own house which is made of adobe and she wants to get ahead. In the San Jose Market (the most important market of the city of Juliaca) she has a small space where she sells delicious food. The aroma that rises from her rich stews is enough to attract people. Her place is very busy and she usually runs out of all the prepared portions. She has been working for fifteen years in this business, which has provided the necessary money to feed her sons and pay for their studies, but she feels that in the future she is going to have more expenses and the money will not be enough. For this reason she wants to start a restaurant to sell her delicious dishes in a more comfortable setting and increase her income. Imelda likes to talk with her clients and enjoys doing that a lot, but it is difficult to attend to all the people that come to her place at the same time. However, she does not falter in her eagerness to move forward and is ready to work hard to achieve that. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be able to repay it on time so as to not create a problem for her community bank where she is very respectful of the other members. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare the meals she sells and be able to sell more portions each day,

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of meals the she sells

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet C. is from the village of Unidos. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Janet owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Zaida Kattia

texts.es:
La señora Zaida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Azangaro, provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, ella es madre soltera con un niño y tiene estudios superiores (Derecho 6to ciclo),  vive en el Barrio Alianza Jr. Potoni 510.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de carne. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de carne de ovino para la venta en la feria.

Su deseo es terminar su carrera y ejercerla.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Zaida belongs to the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank, which is located in the district of Azangaro, in Azangaro, department of Puno, she is 23 years old and is the single mom of a boy and has post-secondary education (Law 6th cycle), she lives in the Alianza Jr. neighborhood. She has been with Manuela Ramos for a year, her first loan was of S/.300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy meat. At this moment she requests a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles to purchase lamb meat and sell it at the fair. Her wish is to finish her degree and have a career. She likes the convenience of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lamb meat

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene19 años y vive con sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a dos negocios de manera paralela: vende jugos por las mañanas y por las tardes atiende un centro de video juegos que instaló en su propia casa. En este último es con el que obtiene mayores ganancias, por lo que está muy contenta con el progreso rápido que ha tenido. En algunas ocasiones sus padres la apoyan, pues todo este esfuerzo lo hace para solventar sus estudios. Janeth desea para el futuro implementar ambos negocios, tanto con mejores utensilios para la venta de jugos, como equipos de video juegos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una nueva integrante en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de una nueva licuadora, vasos y el pago del mantenimiento de los televisores que usa para los video juegos.
texts.en:
Janeth is 19 years old and lives with her parents. For the past year she has been running two businesses simultaneously: in the mornings she sells juices, and in the afternoons she manages a video game center set up in her home. She earns more money with the latter, and is very happy with the rapid progress that she has made. Her parents sometimes help her, because she is doing this to pay for her studies. In the future, Janeth hopes to purchase equipment for both businesses, with better utensils for the sale of juices and video game consoles. This is her first loan with MFP. She is a new member of her communal bank and has promised to be punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase a new blender and glasses, and to pay for the maintenance on televisions used for the video games.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair equipment

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia runs a general store. She also sells vegetables for additional income. She wanted her store to improve to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital. This will really help her business. 

Leticia is happily married to Roger and they are blessed with three children, two of whom are still in school. She wanted her two children to finish their studies, like her eldest. She hopes to give them a good future by providing for their educational needs. Letecia believes in this “praying without ceasing” to succeed in life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Juwa

texts.en:
Juwa is 25 years old, married, and has one child.  Her child does not go to school.  

Juwa E. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour.  She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza A. sells dry beans, maize, and groundnut at Elmina near the new market.  Adiza has received junior high school education.  She is married and has one chid. Adiza has been selling dry beans, maize and groundnut since 2006. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and payment of apartment. Her loan will be used to buy more maize, groundnut and beans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize, groundnut and beans to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith T. es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 34 años y es madre de dos hijos menores, ella es madre soltera , se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y  darles lo mejor a sus hijos, se dedica  a la venta de menestras en los diferentes mercados de la localidad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Positiva” desde hace cuatro años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en algunas prendas de vestir para vender.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar un motocarro y de esta forma tener un ingreso económico diario ya que lo alquilará. La meta de Edith es tener un negocio propio de golosinas y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edith T. is a dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 34, and she has two minor children. She is a single mother. She puts forth great effort to get ahead and give her children the best. She sells vegetable stew in the different markets in her area. She has been part of the La Positiva Communal Bank for four years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought some articles of clothing to sell. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). That way she can have a daily income because she will rent it out. Edith’s goal is to have her own sweets business and to keep getting ahead in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a "motocarro" to rent out

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina O.  est âgé de plus de 35 ans, marié et père de trois  enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur O. après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au domaine du commerce et aujourd’hui, il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et de vente des articles divers (Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, laits en poudre, Thés, sucre, savons, etc) depuis plus de trois ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Après le remboursement du précédent prêt avec succès, il sollicite ainsi un deuxième prêt individuel afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.
 Avec ce deuxième prêt, il compte acheter, 5 cartons du thé, 3 sacs du sucre, 2 sacs de bonbons différents, 30 paquets de Chemine-gum 30 paquets d’allumettes, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 cartons de savons, 4 paquets de boissons NBB, 4 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de voisins.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce,  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassina O. is over 35 years of age, married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma ll, the principal city of Sikasso ( third administrative region of the Republic of Mali ) After attempted several unsuccessful businesses, Mr. Outtara started selling a variety of products from a kiosk located in front of an apartment living complex selling cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powered milk, teas, sugar, soaps etc. He is highly sought after by his clients for the quality of his products. To satisfy the needs of his increasing number of clients, he decided last year to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance group. After successfully paying off his first loan, he now requests a second individual loan to better meet his customers needs. With this second loan he plans to buy, 5 boxes of tea, 3 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of assorted candies, 30 packages of chewing gum, 30 packages of matches, 10 assorted cartons of cigarettes, 5 cartons of soap, 4 boxes of NBB drinks, 4 crates of Bramali drinks, etc. He buys his supplies from local wholesalers then resells them at retail prices for cash or credit, to his neighborhood clients. He expects to earn a profit of 150,000 FCFA which will be used to increase his business operating capital, contribute to the family expenses, meet his loan payments and invest into his business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for resale

loans.name: Lazaro Eddy

texts.en:
Lazaro is preparing for the Christmas demand for his product, and will use this loan to purchase more inventory. He sells leather belts, Lazaro does not have an established location for his business. He travels around to different villages around the city of Nagarote and also in the city of Leon and in the northern parts of the country, where he sells his merchandise to vendors who can offer a good price to their customers.

Lazaro is married and has a three-year-old son. He and his wife want to be able to provide all of the necessities for their son. They live outside the city of Nagarote, and his home is equipped with electricity and potable water.

loans.use: capital de trabajo (working capital)

loans.name: Omogbe

texts.en: Paulina is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She sells food. She is a focused, hard-working woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She is happy with her business and assists her husband with the profit from the business. She wishes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Rebeca Hermelinda

texts.es: La Señorita Rebeca es originaria de la comunidad del cantón Chiyax del Municipio de Totonicapan comenta la señorita Rebeca cuando ella tenia ocho años  cuando aprendio el arte como trabajadora con la señora Maria Gutierrez, ella aprendio el dicho trabajo, cuando cumplio quince años decio iniciar su propio negocio, con un capital de dos mil quetzales, día a día lucha para poder incrementar su negocio hoy necesita de un credito que sera utilizado en la compra de tela conos,forros. para poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus cliente principalmente en la época de navidad, y el inicio del ciclo escolar dos mil diez para el uniforme de las niñas.
texts.en:
Señorita Rebeca is from the Chiyax community in the town of Totonicapan. She says that she was eight years old when she learned her craft, working with Señora Maria Gutierrez. At fifteen years of age, having mastered her trade, she started her own business with capital of 2,000 quetzales. Day by day she strives to grow her business. She currently needs a loan to buy fabrics and linings to better satisfy her clients' needs during the holiday period, and also for the girls' uniforms for the start of the 2010 school year.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Peuy

texts.en: Peuy H., 45, is married and lives with her four school-aged children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling fish and vegetables in her village. H. has operated this business since 2008 and is able to earn an income of US$6 per day. Her husband is a driver for a private company in the town, earning an income of US$8 per day to help cover the family expenses. H. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport her fish and vegetables for sale in her village. She thinks that this expected loan will enable her to cut back on public transportation expenses and save more money. In the future, she hopes she will be able to make bigger improvements in her business. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family, and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Heradio Adrian

texts.es: Heradio Adrian tiene 61 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes, a pesar de la difícil situación es un hombre que sabe, administrar su negocio y poco a poco fue mejorando pues tenía a sus 4 hijos a su cargo, esto lo motiva a seguir adelante, porque sus hijos necesitan estudios, medicamentos y otras cosas básicas. El financiamiento que este hombre luchador necesita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, leche, detergente entre otras cosas. El sueño de Heradio es obtener las suficientes ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Heradio Adrian is 61 years old, and his main economic activity is a grocery store. He has had this store for more than 9 years, and currently has many customers. In spite of a difficult situation, he is a man who knows how to run his business, and little by little he has been improving it. Since he had 4 children in his care, this motivated him to continue to push ahead, because his children need education, medicine, and other basic things. The loan that this hardworking man needs is to buy candy, fruit drinks, bread, milk, detergent, and other items. Heradio's dream is to have sufficient income to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy grocery items

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia M. V. es trabajadora activa de la universidad unan-Carazo es profesora de esta universidad, es casada esta recién alumbrada tiene 20 días de que dio a luz a un precioso bebe, el crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, piedrín, cemento y hierro para la construcción de un cuarto para su bebe. Y si los créditos le han impactado mucho le han ayudado a remodelar su casa y comprar algunos electrodomésticos necesarios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia M. V. is a professor at UNAN-Carazo (University of Nicaragua--Carazo campus). She is married and recently gave birth to a beautiful baby. This new mother is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like stone, gravel, cement and iron in order to build a room for her baby. These loans have been a great help to her. They have helped her remodel her house and buy some necessary home appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, stone, gravel and cement

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina D. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 42 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Cerelina owns and operates a clothing business which provides clothing repairs to local community members. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cerelina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Cerelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a businesswoman who loves selling groceries at retail prices to her customers and hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting  a loan of N50,000 from LAPO, with whom she has a good relationship, to purchase more groceries to sell. A 35-year-old mother of four children, Janet is married to a commercial driver who also supports their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: 68-year-old Luz M. uses her skill in dressmaking for a business. This is her way to earn money and help her children financially. Despite her age, Luz still dreams of having her own dress shop in the future. She wants her clothing designs to be recognized by more people, not just in her own village but in the whole town as well. She is requesting another loan from ASHI. Her family, especially her grand children, are her reasons to work hard and grow her business. She wants them to experience a better kind of life through the profits from her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for dress making.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 33 años, casada y madre de una pequeña hija, de apenas 3 años, juntos viven en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 2 años, decidió instalar el servicio de Internet, por lo que  situó cabinas en un espacio que le cedieron sus suegros. La gran demanda de este servicio, le ha generado considerables rentas, por ser el único que ofrece este servicio en su localidad,  es así que atiende todos los días, alquilando por horas sus computadoras. Ahora planea dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas y ofrecer mayor comodidad y calidad a sus clientes cibernautas. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de muebles nuevos para sus computadoras.
texts.en:
Soledad is 33 years old, married, and the mother of a 3-year-old daughter. They live in the house of their in-laws. Two years ago, Soledad decided to install Internet service in cubicles in a space provided by her in-laws. There has been great demand for this service, which has generated good income. This is the only service of this type in the neighborhood, and they are open every day, renting computers by the hour. Now, Soledad is planning maintenance for the computers and offering more comfort and quality for her web-surfing clients. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is committed to being responsible with her payments. She considers the support that she receives will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of new furniture for the computers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture for computers

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Agriculture has, from time immemorial, been the backbone of Uganda’s economy. Different genres of agricultural activities have allowed many Ugandan families to have an improved lease of life. An example is this story of K. James from Ibanda district.

This married gentleman has subsisted on his banana plantation for the last ten years. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected his gardens, James has managed to consolidate the gains he has made. As a result, his family of five children has enjoyed the benefits: principally, his children all now attend good institutions of learning.

James gleefully reveals that he makes, in a month, close to or even more than 200,000 Ugandan shillings from selling bananas. He is very upbeat that, with this loan, he will be in position to improve the mulching and gardening aspects of his business.

loans.use: To purchase stakes and other farm tools including fertilizer.

loans.name: Comlan

texts.en:
Monsieur Comlan A. is 38 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. He and his wife have one child.

Comlan sells frozen food products at a store called “Saint Esprit.” He requests his first loan of 300,000 XOF from WAGES to help him increase his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen products to sell

loans.name: Fatou Manda

texts.fr: Fatou Manda COULIBAKY est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 22 janvier 2003 et a 14 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pate d’arachide et l’objet de son crédit actuel est de renforcer son niveau d’investissement et d’augmenter sa production. Son principal objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par exemple la nourriture, la santé, l’éducation et l’habillement.
texts.en:
Fatou Manda COULIBAKY, 37, is married and raising five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since January 22, 2003 and has received 14 consecutive loans. She makes and sells peanut butter, and the goal of this loan is to increase her working capital and raise production. Her main intent is to help support her family in terms of food, healthcare, education, and clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and expand her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr  Miguel   es soltero, vive con sus padres,  tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende accesorios para teléfonos y recarga de saldos,  en el barrio las mercedes ,  la venta en la  misma es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactoria.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en un microempresario exitoso y en constante progreso.
Actualmente el desea vender además de accesorios, celulares de distintos modelos con el podrá mejorar mucho  sus ingreso, para concretar la compra el solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and lives with his parents. He has a small business selling cell phone accessories and credit for pre-paid cell phones in the Mercedes neighborhood. Selling his products is gratifying, and he has a considerable number of clients making him a satisfactory income. With his wife's help, they are succeeding with a strong will, work, and dedication. Their business has become a successful microenterprise, and they are always showing progress. Currently, he is hoping to sell several different models of cell phones along with the accessories. This would greatly increase his income. He is applying for the loan to purchase a supply of cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phones, cell phone accessories, and pre-paid phone cards

loans.name: Marites Ediline

texts.en: Marites Ediline G. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old, is single, and has three infant children. Marites Ediline owns and operates a specialized retail store selling dried fish and also on a consignment basis for the suppliers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Marites Ediline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia R. is from the city of Ambalatungan Santiago. She is 48 years old, is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells a raised animal.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel B. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Noel owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products such as homemade ice cream in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang R. is 46 years old and the mother of five children: two are single and the other three are married and have already started new families. 

In the beginning of 2007, Yang R. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few grocery items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she and her husband always cultivate crops during the farming season. Yang R. is taking out her first loan to buy a plot of neighboring farmland in a good location for her family, where she will plant more crops.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to plant more crops

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda operates a tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $195 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair her vehicle for better service.

She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 11th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Canbuhin, Brgy. Mambugsay, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: vegetable vending and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Fernando, aged 44, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children aged from six to 17. Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired to something better for her family. 

With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,100, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable farm and food for her pigs so she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Jocelyn R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pig food

loans.name: Pehinia

texts.en:
Pehinia D. is from the village of Estrada. She is 55 years old. Pehinia is widowed and has four grown children. To make a living, Pehinia owns and operates a general store. Pehinia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Pehinia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Pehinia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Pehinia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional cosmetics

loans.name: Henry Ismael

texts.es: Henry Ismael tiene 21 años, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene 1 hijo y estudia. El se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo ciertos productos, ya que no tenía mucho capital de trabajo. Su negocio fue una herencia de su familia. Por lo que el principal objetivo es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para materia prima. El deseo de Henry es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Henry Ismael is 21 years old and single.  He has one child and studies.  His business is selling clothes.  He has been in this business for more than 5 years.  He started out selling certain products but didn't have much working capital.  His business was an inheritance from his family.  His main objective is to fulfil the needs of his customers, offering them what they need.  This is why he is turning to  Fundación León 2000.  Through them and other friendly organizations who give necessary support he has requested a loan to provide working capital for raw materials.  Henry's wish is to expand his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mwanabena

texts.en:
Mwanabena is a married woman with eight children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates an open air food market from home, selling to her neighbours and to school children. Mwanabena faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, it becomes difficult to sell in an open place. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.
