With the 50,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosalina es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de postres como ser gelatinas, flanes, y tortas de yogurt desde hace dos años y medio. Tiene tres hijos y dos de ellos en edad escolar. Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la zona de villa Liitoral que esta ubicada a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad. Cada día rosa se despierta muy temprano por las mañanas y sale a vender los postres a las tiendas y colegios de las zonas cercanas. La madre de Rosalina   la Sra. Alina, es quien ayuda en la preparación de los postres y las tortas y además tiene buen conocimiento de la preparación de masitas como ser empanadas y rollos de queso. Rosa junto a su madre quieren ampliar su negocio e incrementar su producción con la venta de masitas y es por lo que quieren comprar un horno de 6 latas y una maquina sobadora de masa.
texts.en:
Rosalina is very hard-working young person.  She makes desserts such as jellies (jell-o), flans and yogurt cakes.  She has been doing this for two and a half years.  Rosalina has three children, two of whom are school age.  She lives with her husband and children in Villa Litoral district which is thirty minutes from the city center.

Every day, Rosalina gets up very early in the morning and goes out to sell her desserts to stores and schools in neighboring districts.  Rosalina's mother, Alina, helps her make her desserts and cakes and also has a good knowledge of how to prepare pastries such as empanadas and cheese rolls.  Together with her mother, Rosalina would like to expand the business and increase her production and sale of pastries.  For this reason, she would like to buy a 6 compartment oven and a kneading machine for dough.

loans.use: To buy an oven and a kneading machine for dough

loans.name: Doralisa Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Doralisa, tiene 33  años de edad, hace algunos años tuvo una relación de la cual tuvo tres hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años, en la actualidad   mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años, sus hijos estudian unos en escuela y otro en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  también  se desplaza a otros cantones donde tiene clientes a los que les deja sus productos. Trabaja todos los días en las  tardes y noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen de  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otros Bancos. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The 22 de Julio (July 22nd) Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza church in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known to be a very commercial zone, also known for its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people.

In this place we find Mrs. Doralisa. She is 33 years old, and has three children from a previous relationship who are 15, 11, and 6 years old. She currently is involved in a relationship and she and her partner have two children who are 4 and 1 year old. Her children study at the school and one is in high school. Her partner is a salesman.

She works selling clothing. Part of her sales are door to door, and she also travels to other places where she sells to other customers. She works every day in the afternoon and night and on the weekends, she works all day. Her customers buy on credit and pay every other week. She brings her merchandise from Guayaquil every other week or every month according to her needs.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the community bank for three years and she likes it because the interest rates are low when compared to other banks. She dreams that her children will never be in need.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Margarita Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Margarita. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 9 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.

Ella trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela de la localidad, pero además tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 14 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos papeles. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en: The Por Un Nuevo Amanecer (For A New Dawn) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its handicrafts recognized on a national and international level. It's also famous for its Panama hats. It is here we find Margarita, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, ages 16, 9 and 8, who are all in school. Her husband is a locksmith. Margarita works as a teacher at a local school, but she also has a small sewing shop where for many years she has made a living sewing all kinds of clothing. She works based on orders from individuals who require her services. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., sometimes even later when she has orders to fulfill. She plans to use this loan to purchase fabric and other sewing supplies. She has had 14 loans with this community bank, and she likes it because the credits are quick without much paperwork. Her dream is to have a bigger sewing shop as well as a warehouse in the city center where she could sell her items.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Odsaihan

texts.en:
Odsaihan is 24 years old and lives with her brother in an apartment in Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her brother works as a taxi driver, using his own car. 

Odsaihan operates a vegetable business out of a stall at the local trade center in her town. She began her grocery business in 2010 after operating a cosmetic-products business, which was started in 2008. Her current business has proven profitable. 

Odsuren is a very creative and clever young lady and says, "I plan to expand my business further so that I can help with my sibling to start operating (a) new business in the future." 

She is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to enlarge and improve her stall, where she sells her products.

loans.use: To enlarge and improve her stall

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol M. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Carol is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Carol is raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Carol has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carol joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carol is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Carol from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia L. is from the village of Villa Fermin Echague, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Amelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelia owns & operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz D. P. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Luz works in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Maria Luz has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Maria Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Luz is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be Maria Luz's first loan taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun P. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of 2 US dollars per day. Her husband sells soy milk, and earns 3 US dollars per day. Each month, the family has to spend 11 dollars on food and 30 dollars on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; la socia tiene 38 años de edad casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de tarwi para después llevarlo a vender al mercado de Cusco los días de feria sabados, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Bernardina, 38, is a member of the “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA” communal bank located in the community of Yuncaypata which belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store.  She sells basic need items like: rice, sugar and milk.  She’s also a tarwi (an Andean legume) merchant in Cusco’s  market on Saturdays.  She is a very cheerful person who very much wants to get ahead with her family.

She is asking for the loan to stock her grocery store.  She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying her installments.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn M. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old. Rizalyn is married and has three school-aged children. Rizalyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice and corn in the local community. Rizalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Rizalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. 

This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. Rizalyn is requesting 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice & corn. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice & corn

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Mary N., who is in her early thirties, is single and has a two-year-old daughter. She has been running a pharmacy since 2006. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and makes a small monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With it, she will buy more medicines. Her dream is to one day build her own house as she already has the land.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "Mtazamo" which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mary is in the front, first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: María Hilmer

texts.es:
La Sra. María Hilmer pertenece al Banco Comunal “Lideres del Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 30 años y tiene un niño de 1 año.

Desde muy pequeña le gustaba los negocios, es así que ya de joven decide trabajar a medio tiempo en el negocio de alimentos (preparación de comida), gracias a sus propios recursos y después de un año decide solo dedicarse a su negocio.

Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00  comprará más insumos como fideos, arroz, carnes, verduras  para la preparación de los menús  y futas para la elaboración de refrescos y así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

María es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant propio.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.

En la foto podrán apreciar a uno de sus más frecuentes clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Hilmer is a member of the community bank "Lideres del Futuro II" (Leaders of the Future II) which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province and department of San Martin. She is 30 years old, is single and has a one year old son. 

From a young age, she liked business so as a young woman she decided to work part time preparing food. Thanks to her own means she decided after a year to pursue her own business. 

With this loan of 1000 PEN she will buy supplies such as pasta, rice, meat and vegetables to prepare meals and fruits to make soft drinks so that she can take better care of her customers. 

Maria is a hard working woman. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She is very grateful to field partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have the opportunities to realize their dreams. 

One of her frequent customers appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as pasta, rice, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 22 years old.  She is married and has one child who is two years old.  She also cares for another dependent child who is a relative. 

Catherine has been running a boutique for five years. She works from 8am until 8pm every day.  She has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more water, cooking oil, cassava flour, juice and so on.  With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits than before. This will enable her to buy her own house, pay school fees for her child and save for the future.

loans.use: buy more water, oil, flour, juice, etc. to resell

loans.name: Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: GRÂCE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La présidente du groupe, Hortense (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 20 Septembre 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Michel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Hortense et son mari vivent ensemble avec l'enfant. Hortense a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Hortense prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.), qu'elle vend dans un quartier du Bénin. Hortense exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Hortense vend de la bouillie de maïs. Hortense s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hortense sollicite un crédit avec les membres du groupe GRÂCE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
GRÂCE DE DIEU is a group composed of three persons whose president resides in the same district in Benin. The group’s president, Hortense (whose hand is raised in the photo) was born on September 20, 1973 in Benin and is married to a mechanic by the name of Michel. The couple has two children, both in school. One of the children lives with the couple. 

Hortense has had little schooling. For nearly seven years, she has been making food (corn mash and rice served with fish sauce, etc.) that she sells in her district in Benin. She operates this business with passion, and it enables her to support herself and her children. Secondarily, she sells corn porridge. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers. Hortense is requesting a loan along with the members of the group GRÂCE DE DIEU. This loan will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sauce condiments, fish, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 42 años, es madre soltera quien tiene 4 hijos con quien vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Celia es una mujer con mucho talento, ella desde el día en que se divorcio de su marido supo valorarse mucho. Con las mismas ganas que lo caracteriza decidió incursionar en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de cacao. A ella siempre le ha gustado respetar la calidad de su producto antes que todo, es por ello que ya tiene compradores potenciales bien ganados. Su forma de trabajo es consecuencia de mucha dedicación en su terreno de cultivo, donde le dedica 10 horas diarias, solo que los días domingos se da un descanso para que este con su familia. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos pero ocasionalmente tiene a cargo de sus peones cuando es temporada de cosecha. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Por otro lado tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde son sus hijos quienes se hacen cargo de dicho negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella agradece a su banco comunal por el trabajo transparente que ellos realizan. Con los 1.500 soles podrá invertirlo en el cultivo de cacao, donde comprará semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Celia, aged 42, is a single mother with four children with whom she lives in her own home.  She lives in the community of Puerto Mayo, in the district of Pichari.  

Celia is a very talented woman, who has been able to appreciate many things since the day she and her husband divorced.  With the same enthusiasm that characterizes her, she decided to enter farming, in particular the production and selling of cocoa.  She has always liked to focus on the quality of her product first and foremost, which is why she has already earned potential buyers.  

Her work is the result of much dedication to her farming land where she spends 10 hours a day; it is only on Sundays that she has a break to be with her family.  She usually works together with her children, but occasionally she is in charge of her workers when it is harvest season.  She normally sells her product in the collection centers in her area. On the other hand, she has a small grocery store where her children are in charge of the business. 

This is her second loan through MFP, and she is committed to being prompt in paying her repayments.  She appreciates her community bank for the transparent work they do.  With the 1,500 Soles, she would be able to invest in her cocoa cultivation by buying seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a shop since 2009, where he sells a wide range of car spare parts. His products are designed for different types of cars. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. With his business income, he is able to help his father pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his tools and purchase an air compressor in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. In the future, he is planning to start working as a car mechanic in addition to selling car spare parts.

loans.use: to renew his tools and purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: In Cambodia, there are many kind of jobs. Mrs. Phann has been running a business as a roast-beef seller near a market for many years. Whereas her husband, he operates a motorbike driver in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Furthermore, both of them can earn about $9 per day and so far they have six kids. To help the family live in comfortable situation, two of the six kids are working in the garment factory workers, and they could get extra salary per month.  Mrs. Phann wanted to create a new business to purchase a charcoal oven for making bread but she does not have enough money to buy it .therefore, she wishes to borrow from Kiva loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: To purchase a charcoal oven for making bread.

loans.name: Badenyaton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de dix  femmes, les femmes du groupe BADENYATON 2 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent Farabougou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Tesserela, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Dans l’ensemble les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Mamou (Assise à l’extrême gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un sac de complexe céréales, un sac d’urée, 50 kg de semence d’arachide, recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de sarclage et de récolte dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en semence à la foire de Gouassola, en main d’œuvre pour effectuer les activités de labour par les hommes et de désherbage avec l’association des femmes du village. Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 4 hectares : 8 sacs de mil, 15 sacs d’arachide, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. La moitié de toutes les spéculations cultivées est destinée à la vente et le reste à la consommation familiale. Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer en condiments et en soins de santé des enfants. 
Madame Mamou tout comme les autres femmes de BADENYATON 2 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Badenyaton 2 group are married and live mostly in large traditional families. On average, they are 41 years old and have 3 children each. They live in Farabougou, one of the villages in the rural commune of Tesserela, Segou region (4th administrative district of Mali). The women met through family and marriage connections.

With the goal of having more land to cultivate, the women approached Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 2nd seasonal loan. Overall, the members of the group will grow groundnut, millet and black-eyed peas. Madame Mamou (seated, far left) plans to use her loan to buy one sack of complex cereal, one sack of urea, 50 kg of groundnut seed, as well as to hire workers for plowing, hoeing and harvesting in the fields. She stocks up on seed at the Gouassola fair, and hires laborers: men for plowing, and weeding done by the women's group in the village. Her goal is to cultivate over 4 hectares: 8 sacks of millet, 15 sacks of groundnuts, 2 sacks of black-eyed peas, and hay. Half of all crops grown are for sale and the rest is for the family to use.  Profit is used for small household expenses like condiments and health care for the children. Just like all the women of Badenyaton 2, Madame Mamou's goal is for the village to become self-sufficient for its food needs.

loans.use: to buy inputs, groundnut seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Edis Alberto

texts.es:
Edis, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y pipián, lleva ocho años haciendo este cultivo, y de las cosechas comparte uno para vender y otro para el consumo familiar.
Por el momento está realizando el cultivo de maíz y pipián, para ello necesita comprarse abono y herbicidas para tratar las plagas, estos insumos son muy necesarios para que se pueda desarrollar bien el cultivo y que produzca abundantes frutos, ya que benefician a su familia.
texts.en:
Edis is a farmer. He lives with his wife and son. He plants corn and squash. He has been planting these crops for eight years, and he sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest for his family's consumption.

Right now he is cultivating corn and squash. For this he needs to buy fertilizer and herbicides to treat the pests. These ingredients are very necessary so that his crops can develop well and produce an abundant harvest, since they will benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy feritlizer and herbicides for his corn and squash crops

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia tiene 31 años, tiene 1 hijo  y vive con ella y le ayuda en lo que puede con su negocio. Su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva. El negocio se encuentra de forma ambulante, por lo que todos los días sale a vender los diferentes productos que tiene. Ella realiza su actividad por pedidos y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece su negocio cada vez está creciendo más, sus pedidos están aumentando y esto ha hecho que piense en ampliar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y que toda su vida ha velado por el bienestar de los suyos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, trajes, ropa interior, camisas, faldas,  entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia is 31 years old and has one son who lives with her.  She helps him as far as she can with her business.  Her main business activity is selling new clothes.  She carries out her business as an itinerant vendor and goes out every day to sell her different products.  Claudia works to order and, owing to the quality of the products that she sells, her business is growing, her orders are increasing and so she is planning to expand.

Claudia is an entrepreneurial woman who has spent her entire life looking out for her family's well-being.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, dresses, underwear, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, underwear, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Khuong

texts.en:
Khuong, 42, is the father of two daughters. Together with his wife and children, Khuong lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income from selling fruit from their streetside stall. He began this business 15 years ago.

Every morning they buy common seasonal fruit such as plums, pineapples, watermelons, cherries, and bananas to sell in their stall. Khuong would like a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit so that he can attract more customers. 

He hopes that, through the loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit for selling.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 28-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in the Kaya Road area in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. She hopes to expand her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vakundi Group

texts.en: Isaac is 24 years old and he and his wife sell matemba (a small dried fish) in the local market. They have one child – a baby of seven months. They also look after two further dependants. They have been in business for two years and their main problem is not having enough stock to meet local demand. They will use the money they borrow to buy more stock. They are confident that there is sufficient demand. Isaac will use the profits to take better care of his family. He also intends to diversify into rearing poultry.

loans.use: to buy more fish for stock

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Dionicia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, comercio, venta de calzados, venta de artículos varios, venta de ropa. 

La señora Dionicia  indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de zapatos que viene trabajando desde hace quince años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de zapatos) que comprará de la ciudad de La Paz  y lo comercializa en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The “Kantuta” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Dionicia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, commerce, shoe sales, assorted merchandise sales and clothing sales.

Dionicia says that this is the first cycle she’s joined in Pro Mujer having been invited through a promotion.  She sells shoes at present, a business she’s had for the last 15 years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase merchandise.  She will buy shoes in the city of La Paz to then sell in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family in the best way possible since she’s married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Llamiletk

texts.es:
En el Municipio del Sauce la señora Llamiletk posee altos principios morales y sobre todo se ha destacado por ser una excelente persona ganándose el aprecio de muchos en su localidad.

Actualmente se presentó a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Para esto requiere materiales de construcción tales como arena y cemento. Con esto empezará su obra y de esta forma beneficiará a su familia que tanto depende de ella.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce, Llamiletk has high moral principles and, above all, she stands out as an excellent person who has gained the esteem of many people in her town.

Llamiletk came to Ceprodel to request a loan with which to improve the condition of her home.  To do this work, she needs building supplies such as sand and cement.  With these supplies, she will start the job and benefit her family who depend on her so much.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 20 años, ella vende frutas de temporada en un puesto que instalas en ferias libres. Su horario de trabajo es de domingo a viernes. Comenta que le va muy bien y conserva clientela antigua. 
Su mercadería la compra en la vega monumental.
Con el crédito comprará frutas de temporada  para abastecer su negocio, entre estos duraznos, cerezas, frutillas y paltas.
Sus metas en el negocio son prosperar y mantenerlo en el tiempo.
Jacqueline vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19, 13 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son realizarse un tratamiento dental.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, solidario y empático con los demás integrantes. Además ha sido una nueva experiencia y le sirve como distracción de las labores domesticas. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para distribuir mejor sus ganancias.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the communal bank “Fuerza de Mujer” located in the city of Temuco. She has been in business for 20 years and sells seasonal fruit at a stall in the open markets. She works Sundays to Fridays and she says that she is doing very well and retains her old customers. She buys her merchandise at the Vega Monumental.

With the loan she will buy seasonal fruit to stock up her business such as peaches, cherries, strawberries and avocados. Her business goals are to prosper and take care of it in time. Jacqueline lives with her husband and their 4 children aged 23, 19, 13 and 6 years. Her dreams at the personal level are to have dental treatment. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo and the hope of investing in her business. She also comments that the communal bank she is a part of is very united, supportive and empathetic to other members. It has also been a new experience for her and serves as a distraction from her domestic work. Regarding the training this has helped her better distribute her profits.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Around it lie a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and striking native flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby parks. It should be noted that this region is inhabited by 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people that exist in our country.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to stock her business such as peaches, cherries, strawberries and avocados.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal (pictured above) is 32 years old and his wife, Tha is 31 years old. They live in a village about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet. His wife is a garment worker. 

Sal has two lines of business: (1) purchase and sale of rice, (2) raising pigs and fish. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase additional rice for sale and to buy fish feed.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for sale and to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es:
Angel Vinicio tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Angel se dedica a la agricultura y además es albañil . Las compras y las ventas de los productos para la agricultura los compra en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales ganado, oveja y terneros. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la crianza del ganado. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.
En el tiempo libre le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Vinicio is 24 years old, single and has no children.  He lives with his father in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.

He’s a member of the Ventanilla Pangua communal bank, located in the Pangua Chaupiyacu community of the Guanujo Cantón Guaranda parish.  It’s 15 minutes from the Ventanilla Pangua’s office.  Most of its members farm, raise livestock, and do other things, like business and construction, where they can earn incomes.

Angel is a farmer and also works as a mason.  He buys and sells his agricultural products in Guaranda.  He is asking for this loan to buy livestock, such as sheep and also land.  This loan will help him raise livestock.  He has not had any other problems.

He likes to enjoy the carnival in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy sheep and land.

loans.name: Vachik

texts.en: Vachik, 51 years old, lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan, with his wife. Vachik’s children are married and they live separately from their parents. Vachik worked for a long time at the Gagarin village light-technical factory and then was engaged in shoe and cup production. In 2006, Vachik began an agricultural business. He has 4 cows and some sheep on his farm. As Vachik’s wife is jobless, she helps her husband with the farming. They produce butter and cheese and sell them, along with beef and lamb, in their village. Farming allows Vachik to provide for his family and support his children’s families as well. Vachik intends to develop his farm, so he is seeking a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy 3 more cows for his farm. This will allow Vachik to produce more butter and cheese and thus to increase his family’s income in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 more cows for his farm

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Originario de Leo, es Juan un humilde comerciante de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mariscos, su nivel de estudios es bien básico llego hasta sexto grado de primaria, el tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad ambos están en la escuela.
El inicio con su negocio con capital propio con la liquidación que le dieron de su anterior trabajo también vendía raspados pero noto que a venta de mariscos le generaba buenos ingresos por eso hoy en día solo se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Sus punto de ventas es en los mercados donde Se desplaza a lo largo del día para vender sus fresco pescados. El requiere el préstamo para compra de mariscos. Además en su casa tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de pollo el cual también quiere sacar adelante pues el dice que necesita darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Born in Leo, Juan is a humble businessman, 38 years old, who dedicates himself to selling seafood. His level of education is quite basic: he reached the sixth grade of primary school. He has two children, aged 16 and 7, and both of them are in school. 

He started his business with his own capital, with the severance payment he received from his previous job. He also sold raspados [shaved ice with syrup], but he noticed that selling seafood generated a good income, and therefore he now dedicates himself only to selling seafood. He makes his sales at the markets, to which he travels throughout the day to sell his fresh fish. He needs the loan to buy seafood. In his home, he also has a small business raising and selling chickens, which he would also like to expand, since he says that he needs to provide a better standard of living for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Martin Manuel

texts.es:
Martín Manuel tiene 39 años es casado y vive con su cónyuge, con los tres hijos, de 7,9 y 14 años. Vive en el Recinto Caimito en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES   se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Martín Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,   así también se dedica a la labor de maestro constructor.  Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, insumos, abonos para la siembra del maíz, así también para la compra de víveres y confitería para su bar. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder gozar de una buena salud y así poder estar unidos con la familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta trabajar en lo que sea.
texts.en:
Martín Manuel is 39 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and three children who are seven, nine and fourteen years old. He lives in the Caimito precinct in the canton of Ventanas. 

The communal bank La Verdad Nos Hará Libres is located in the San Vicente las Lomas precinct in the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank focuses on agricultural works in short cycle planting of corn, rice, beans, and soy. 

Martín Manuel makes a living planting corn. He also works as master builder. He makes both his purchases and his sales in Ventanas. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for planting corn. He will also buy supplies and pastries for his bar. 

The loan helps him to increase his income for his family's consumption. His dream is to be able to enjoy good health and in that way be able to have a united family. 

I like to work on whatever in my free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers to plant corn.

loans.name: Maria Flores

texts.en:
Maria Flores is 57 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 
Maria Flores has a fish vending business and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Maria Flores has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nyantop

texts.en:
Nyantop lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Nyantop heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon lives in Gugarq village. He lives with his wife and two children ages 9 and 4 children.
He has been driving a taxi using his own car for 5 years. Levon is the only breadwinner in the family as his wife takes care of their children and household.
Now, by applying for this loan Levon asks financial support to be able to renovate the car4 and purchase new tires. The loan is very important for Levon as his car is damaged and he isn't able to continue his business.
Levon has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
The only hope for renovation his car is this loan, so Levon waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car, purchase new tires

loans.name: Mahucheme Group

texts.fr: MAHUCHEME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe, Marguerite (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Marguerite est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et deux sont à leur charge.  Marguerite vit ensemble avec sa famille. Marguerite n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Marguerite mène comme activité la vente de poissons frais depuis plus de quinze ans. De façon secondaire, Marguerite vend des tissus et des bijoux. Marguerite achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la septième fois que Marguerite et son groupe MAHUCHEME sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des bijoux.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
My name is Asunción and my business is called M.’ Grocery Store. It is located near to the school Jose Trinidad Reyes, which helps me sell my products. During the night I sell sweets because there is a lot of traffic in this area and the school has three daily segments of classes. My earnings help me care for my children in their studies and in my familial expenses.

Loan Use: Buying batteries, juices, milk, churros ( a type of sweet pastry), cookies, condiments, coffee and other items.

Me llamo Asuncion, y mi negocio lleva el nombre de Pulperia M.. Esta ubicada cerca de la escuela Jose Trinidad Reyes, lo que me ayuda a vender mis productos. Por las noches vendo golosinas ya que esta zona es bastante transitada y el colegio tiene tres jornadas diarias de clases. Los ingresos me ayudan atender a mis hijos en sus estudios y gastos de familia.

loans.use: Compra de baterias, jugos, leche, churros, galletas, condimentos, cafe y otros.

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub sells Shoes. He was born in 1977 in Sumgait. This 30-year-old single man began his business 15 years as borrow-boy. Because the family condition was very heavy. In the beginning of his business he sold clothes. Now he has rented the shop and he needs a loan of $500 to expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.use: To expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa S. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S.’s wife, Savin (who is pictured here because S. was unavailable), works at home watching their children and growing vegetables for the family to eat.  Mr. S. works as a taxi driver and can make about $15 per day (excluding costs of petrol).  S. hopes to use this loan to repair his taxi so that it is more reliable for his clients.  In the future, S. and Savin hope to have enough money to send their children through high school and university.

loans.use: To fix his car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Isakh

texts.en:
Isakh is 36 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDP. He is married and has 2 children.
This young man has sold milk for 5 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: He would like to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
I am 22 years old and have been working in a beauty parlor for about six years. My work is my life as I am divorced, without any children. I love what I do and want to make a name for myself in my locality. While I will continue working as an employee at the beauty parlor, I want to open my own salon in my house. I am confident my business will do well as there are many potential clients in my locality. I need a loan to buy cosmetics for my new business.

Anam T., Pakistan

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to set up a beauty salon

loans.name: Dibe

texts.en: Dibe is a 22-year-old woman. She lives in the region of Tyre and works in the agriculture sector, growing vegetables in greenhouses. Dibe is divorced and lives on her own. She is striving to ensure a decent living. She is taking the initiative to expand her business by buying sheep in order to generate more revenue, which will allow her to stay financially independent.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia is a woman with dreams of getting ahead. She saved for a long time to come up with 5,000 cordobas to be able to start her business of selling various products 11 years ago. At first, she rented the location of her business, but thanks to her efforts, she has managed to buy it. It is in good condition, made of concrete with an artificial floor. It's located in the central market in the city of Chinandega. Before opening her own business, she worked as a street vendor.

The work that this head of family has done has been gratifying because it has let her take good care of her son. Now she feels happy and fortunate because in addition to the love of her son, she has the love of her grandson. Her work with CEPRODEL started around 3 years ago, and she has had 15 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

NOELIA ES UNA MUJER CON DESEOS DE SUPERACIÓN. DURANTE MUCHO TIEMPO AHORRO PARA REUNIR LA CANTIDAD DE CS$5,000.00 PARA PODER COMENZAR SU NEGOCIO DE PRODUCTOS VARIOS HACE11 AÑOS.

AL INICIO ALQUILABA EL LOCAL, PERO GRACIAS A SUS ESFUERZOS LO LOGRO COMPRAR. LAS CONDICIONES SON BUENAS, PUES EL LOCAL ES DE CONCRETO CON PISO ARTIFICIAL Y ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE LA CIUDAD DE CHINANDEGA. ANTES DE PONER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO ERA VENDEDORA AMBULANTE.

EL TRABAJO QUE HA DESEMPEÑADO ESTA JEFA DE FAMILIA LE HA SIDO GRATIFICANTE PUES HA SACADO A SU HIJO ADELANTE Y AHORA SE SIENTE FELIZ Y DICHOSA YA QUE ADEMAS DEL AMOR DE SU HIJO TIENE EL AMOR DE SU NIETO.

SU TRABAJO CON CEPRODEL INICIA HACE ALREDEDOR DE 3 AÑOS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 15 CRÉDITOS.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Iti

texts.en: Iti is 28 years old and is married. She has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, beverages,  vegetables, etc., and she usually earns about US$ 17 per day. Her husband, S., sells food and can earn about US$ 5 per day. Iti is requesting a loan to buy some goods to fill the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her little shop

loans.name: Sally Shalin

texts.es:
Ms. Sally belongs to the “Guadalupe” Communal Bank and lives in Av Colonización 682, Calleria district of the Ucayali area. She is 27 years old, married and mother of two small children. Her husband is a motorcycle-taxi driver. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she invested in the purchase of a motorcycle taxi.

She presently owns three taxis. Her husband drives one of them and she hires drivers for the other two. She gets up at 7 am daily to tend to the household chores.

With the current loan of 1000 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will be able to give proper maintenance to her motorcycles.

According to Sally, she is doing very well, as the money she collects from her drivers is enough to pay her monthly bills timely and to support her children's education, which gives her tranquility and stability. The support received from Manuela Ramos is very important to her and she is very grateful for it.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sally pertenece al Banco Comunal Guadalupe, vive en la Av Colonización 682, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aún son menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es motocarrista (transportista). Sally, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con 3 motocarros, en uno de ellos trabaja el esposo, y además tiene 2 choferes a su cargo. Ella se levanta a las 7 a.m. para dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, podrá dar mantenimiento a sus motocarros.

Sally manifiesta que todo le va muy bien, ya que el dinero que le entregan sus choferes le alcanza para pagar puntualmente sus mensualidades y para apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, lo que le permite gozar de tranquilidad y estabilidad. Para ella es muy importante el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos y esta muy agradecida.

loans.use: Motorcycle taxis maintenance.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 61 year old father of 2. Mohamad lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He owns a sandwich restaurant. This is the fifth time Mohamad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to pay for the maintence of his restaurant.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his restaurant

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 38 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 9 months to 20 years old. Tabu began her food and alcohol business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S. is a 29-year-old subsistence farmer in Kampong Cham province. After feeding her family, she only makes a little less than $1 per day from her yields. Her husband farms with her and adds only $1 per day to their income. The couple has two children who they hope to someday be able to afford to send to school.

Farming is a difficult and unstable enterprise due to the fact that weather patterns have begun to behave erratically in recent years, putting most farmers under financial strain. San and her husband therefore want to branch out into raising livestock by purchasing pig food for the piglets that recently came into their possession. If they can develop this business it will lead to greater financial security and possibly education for their children.

loans.use: To buy food for raising pigs.

loans.name: Agbelenko

texts.fr:
Born on March 23, 1954 in Ahépé (Yoto prefecture), Agbélénko A. is married and has six people in his care, including his children. He makes and sells medicinal ointments. Despite his efforts, his income does not allow him to cover all expenses. Nevertheless, he has the trust and the esteem of his customers because of the quality of his products. He manages his business correctly and is always honest in repaying the loans he has gotten.

For the purposes of growing his business, he is requesting a loan to bolster his ointment production and also to start raising pigs. With this loan, his sales figures can increase, and he will be able to invest more in the education and health of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 23 mars 1954 à Ahépé (P/Yoto), Monsieur A. Agbélénko est marié et à six (06) personnes à charge dont ses enfants. Il fait la fabrication et la vente des pommades salicilées. Malgré les efforts, son revenu ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges. Toutefois, il a la confiance et l’estime des clients à cause de la qualité de ses produits. Il gère de façon correcte son activité et est toujours honnête dans le remboursement des crédits obtenus.

En vue d’accroître ses activités, il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer la fabrication des pommades et aussi, initier l’élevage de porcs. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaire pourra augmenter et il pourra investir plus dans l’éducation et la santé de la famille.

loans.use: To make medicinal ointments

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mrs. Elisabeth K. is 45 years old and is originally from the town Ganvie, one of the best known in Benin. She is married and the mother of six, the oldest of which, Jean, is 17 years old and is in high school. A true survivor, Mrs. K. works in the field of sales since a very young age when her mother initiated her in the business. However, she has only recently begun her sales of motor oil 3 years ago. She has also become very well known in her district. She also sells fish. She is requesting her first loan with Alide to expand her economic activities. Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.


Agée de 45 ans, Dame K. Elisabeth est originaire du village lacustre le plus connu du Bénin, Ganvié. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont le premier, Jean, 17 ans, est en classe de 4ème. Vraiment une battante, Dame K., est dans le domaine de la revente depuis sa tendre enfance où elle a été initiée par sa mère. Mais, elle s’est engagée dans l’achat et la revente d’huile à moteur depuis 3 ans ; elle en est devenue une grossiste reconnue dans son quartier. Elle vend également du poisson. Elle vient solliciter son premier prêt à ALIDé pour étendre ses activités.

loans.use: To purchase six 50 liter drums of motor oil.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru:
Mehrinisso Zaripovna G., 48, lives in Khuroson district. She and her husband have six children. Mehrinisso has been in business for six years. She currently sells cloth for making national dresses as well as other household goods. She buys her goods wholesale and sells them on for a profit. This business allows Mehrinisso to support her large family. Right now, Mehrinisso would like to purchase additional inventory. In order to do this, she has applied for a ten-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиева Мехриниссо Зариповна жительница района Хуросон . Возраст 48 лет , замужем , имеет 6 детей. Мехриниссо более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она торгует тканями для пошива национального платья и другими товарами народного потребления.Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать большую семью. Она покупает у оптовых поставщиков товар и реализует его в розницу. В данное время она хочет закупить больше товара.Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Mrs. Paquita belongs to the "Esmeralda" bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the Tarapoto district. She sells groceries, soft drinks and candy. Her business is located in her own home, where the clients from her neighborhood come every day.

With this loan of US$700, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy basic necessities such as sacks of rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, packages of noodles, various brands and sizes of soft drinks, detergents, hygienic paper, and personal hygiene articles. She wants to supply her business in order to satisfy the needs of her clients.

She is 32 years old and has 2 dependent children who help her in the house and in the business. Her future goal is to enlarge her business and increase her inventory in order to maintain a loyal clientele who can find everything they are looking for in a single place.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Paquita pertenece al Banco “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gasificadas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. Sinchi Roca No 468 donde acuden diariamente sus clientes de su barrio. Con este crédito de S/. 2000.00 que pagara en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaños detergentes y papel higiénico, artículos de higiene personal, quiere surtir su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 32 años y 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella quienes le apoyan en la casa y en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar su local y surtir mas el negocio para fidelizar a sus clientes cuando encuentran todo lo que buscan en un solo lugar.

loans.use: Purchase of various grocery products

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem S. is a farmer in Phlov Village in Takeo Province. 

On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field now is infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Hem Choeurn, is a retired soldier who can get a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Soem S. is 42 years old and the mother of six children -- two are employed in a garment factory while the other three help their mother on the plantation. The youngest one is attending school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny V. is 43 years old and lives with her husband, who she married in 1989, about 20 kilometres south of Phnom Penh.  Together they have raised four sons and two daughers; two are married, two are students, one works in another village, and another helps Ny and her husband sell meal to local villagers.  For over 13 years their family has worked together selling meal, which they cook themselves each day and sell in their village every evening.  In order to expand their business by purchasing more meal and equipment, Ny is requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: To purchase more meal and cooking equipment.

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Brisas (“Breezes”) Village Bank.  She is married and 42 years old with two children.  She owns a store in her home on Salazar Bondi Street where she sells dry goods, vegetables, and meats.  She works every day and her son helps out in his free time.  Gloria also gives knitting classes by request and also knits sweaters by special order. 

Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to buy oil, rice and sugar.

Gloria dreams of owning a larger, mini-market style store, and for her children to grow up to be successful professionals.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Gloria es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Gloria tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el jr, Salazar Bondi en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo en sus tiempos libres. Además Gloria da clases particulares D. tejido a personas que le solicitan y también teje chompas a pedido.
Gloria necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aceite, arroz y azúcar.
Gloria sueña con tener una tienda granD. minimarket y que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and sugar

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat lives in Khachmaz town. He is single. This young man was born in 1983. Three years ago he started a mobile phones sales business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy phone accessories to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 34 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Desde muy joven buscó la forma de ayudar a sus padres en los gastos de su hogar y hace 6 años encontró en la ferretería la oportunidad de hacerlo, a pesar de que en un inicio las cosas no resultaron muy bien tuvo que esforzarse mucho para hacer de su negocio una alternativa de desarrollo. Ahora, gracias al buen trato que les da a sus clientes y a la excelente atención que hay en su local, que a pesar de ser alquilado, ha tenido buenos ingresos para solventar sus gastos, sin embargo en estos tiempos desea tener un local propio, y esto significa para ella, esforzarse aún más para realizarlo. Zoila es nueva en MFP, y sus deseos de superación la motivaron a formar parte de este grupo, donde es reconocida como una mujer muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de materiales de construcción, ya que es lo que más solicitan en su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is 34 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. Since she was very young, she sought a way to help her parents with their household expenses, and six years ago found the opportunity to do so in a hardware store. Although things did not start out so well, she endeavored to make an alternative development from her business. Now, thanks to the good treatment she gives her customers and the excellent solicitude in her location, she has had sufficient earnings to cover her expenses. At this time, however, her location is rented, and she wishes to own it. For her, this means working even harder to achieve it. Zoila is new to MFP, and her desire to succeed motivated her to become part of this group, where she is known as a very responsible woman. With this money, she will purchase greater quantities of construction materials, as they are the most sought after in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for her hardware store

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.ru: Зияев Муродбек житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 24 года. Холост . Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист. Но занимается бизнесом. Открыл свой диллерский центр, где обслуживает клиентов денежными переводами и продажей припейд карт. Планирует получить кредит и купить компьютер. Кредит необходим на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murodbek Z. lives in Tursunzade. He is 24 years old and is single. He is a university graduate in Economics and a businessman. He has a call center where he provides money transfer services and sells prepaid cards. Murodbek is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase a computer. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ilva Díaz es una joven mujer que vende en su casa productos variados a sus clientes con una pequeña pulpería  que desde hace siete años administra, ella inicio con ahorros propios y financiamiento de prestamos pequeño, tiene 30 años de edad, reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua,  con cuatro hijos de 4,6,8 y 10 años de edad, y a todos los tiene estudiando, su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía como  conductor, con esta solicitud de crédito quiere comprar granos básicos, productos enlatados y cereales ya que son los consumos diarios de los clientes, y desea ofertarles siempre sus servicios. Sus planes  es poder crecer más en inventario. Da gracias a Afodenic por sus préstamos esta es su novena solicitud  que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su familia y su comercio.
texts.en:
Doña Ilva Díaz is 30 years old and lives in South Laureles, in Managua. She has four children who are 4, 6, 8 and 10, and who are all in school. Her husband works in town as a driver. Doña Ilva sells a variety of products out of her home and for seven years now, this has included homemade juices, a business she started with her own savings and a small loan. With this latest loan, she would like to buy grains, canned goods and cereals, since these are the kinds of products that her clients use every day, and she would like to offer them the most complete service possible. To do this, her plan is to increase the range of products she offers. Doña Ilva is very grateful for the help that Afodenic has provided, and this is her ninth loan. These loans have been very beneficial to her business and also, to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, canned goods and cereals

loans.name: Ruos' Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in Domnak Ompel Commune in Phom Penh City. The group leader, Mrs. S., 28, has been a local cultivator for a long time. She now grows rice and vegetables, as well as raising pigs from home for a daily income. She is married with one child who attends school, whilst her husband works as a staff member for a company.

S.'s house is old; that is why S. is taking a loan for repairing her house. The loan will provide the family with a better standard of living.

The other borrowers in the loan group are as follows:

K., 44, who raises poultry for sale and is looking for a loan to buy chicks to raise;

C., 40, who sells Khmer noodles in the neighborhood and is asking for a loan to buy necessary ingredients for her business;

C., 41, who is a rice farmer and is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation; and

K., 35, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. He is asking for a loan to increase his wife's capital for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
LIBIA T. D. SÁNCHEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry N°  786 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 67 años D. edad, 4 hijos, y su esposo tiene a su cargo la administración del negocio.

Ella se dedica al servicio D. alquiler D. habitaciones y es socia D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años.  Su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo empleó para algunos arreglos D. 2 habitaciones, aunque el préstamo fue pequeño, la ayudo bastante, D. lo contrario no seguiría en el negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el arreglo D. todo el piso en general, ya que sufre D. inundaciones frecuentemente, por ello ya ha contratado a un maestro D. obras y está comprando los materiales necesarios para terminar lo más pronto posible y seguir con sus arrendadores, dándoles un buen servicio.

DesD. que está con Manuela Ramos, siente que hay un apoyo cercano y está conforme con los prestamos que ha recibido, y por ello ella no se atrasa en el pago D. sus cuotas, mas por el contrario hace todo lo posible para no falla.
texts.en:
Libia T. D. S. belongs to the Manos Unidas (United Hands) Communal Bank. Her home is located on Jr. Salaverry in the Callería District. She is 67 years of age and has four children. Her husband is in charge of managing their business and she is responsible for renting the rooms. She has been associated with Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER for five years now. Her first loan of 300 New Sols was used for some repairs for two of their units. Although the loan was small, it was a big help as otherwise she could not have continued in the business. This loan of 3,000 New Sols will be invested in repairing all of the floors which have suffered from frequent flooding. She has contracted with a building foreman for this and is buying all the materials necessary to complete the work as quickly as possible. She wants to retain her tenants and give them good service. Since this loan is with Manuela Ramos, she feels there is close support and she is happy with the loans that she has received. And so she won't be tardy in making her payments. On the contrary, the loans have maD. it all possible and she doesn't want to fail.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building maintenance, to buy flooring materials and pay for installation.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine M. has worked for two years with her clothing business. With HSPFI assistance programs, she was able to mobilize her business. She buys slightly used clothes, shoes, pants, bed sheets and other garments in the city and sells them in her town and neighboring villages through peddling.

Josephine is already 46 years old and has six children to support. Her husband also supports the family with traditional gold-mining work. Josephine is a determined wife. She wants to improve their lives to continually send her children to school. She is in need of PHP11,000.00 to buy more stock such as slightly used clothes, shoes, pants and bed sheets for sale. Josephine wants also to repair her garment stall to properly display her clothing and other garments for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like slightly used clothing, shoes, bed sheets and other garments for sale

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is a 35-year-old married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. All of her children are currently attending primary or junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. Cecilia works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver and she is a textiles trader selling materials such as linen, lace, and printed textiles.  She buys the goods in Accra and sells them in her community and also treks to sell in other towns as well. Cecilia has been in this business for eight years and will use the loan to purchase textiles in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou Macasaddu is 46 years old. Her family lives in the rural village of Gadu Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Edmundo Macasaddu, who is a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with a happy family and hope to provide all their four children with a better education someday.

Marilou manages a vending business where she sells different vegetables, street foods, and canned goods from her vending stall just in front of their house. The business has been in operation for 20 years and she is proud that her long-term business venture has helped her family significantly.

She works hard to help her husband. She gets up in the early morning to prepare her store and goes to the market to buy products in bulk. She has gained a lot of clients and is earning a better profit. But Marilou still needs to save for the college education of her four children, and thus she feels the need to increase her daily income. She would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 17,000. She hopes to further develop her business into a mini-grocery store someday.

Marilou believes that by working hard and having patience, she will maintain her business, which will enable her to achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: To expand her vending business

loans.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Roxana Briceño M. tiene 29 años, vive en el Consejo Menor El Milagro III Sector, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria  Completa,  tiene  2 hijas que depende económicamente de ella.
Verónica se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos y pollos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como pollos y patos, la comida para criarlos.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como pollos y patos, la comida para criarlos para implementar su negocio.
Verónica tiene como sueño tener su granja para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Verónica Roxana Briceño M. is 29 and lives in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied through secondary school and has 2 daughters who depend on her economically. Verónica raises and sells small animals like ducks and chickens. She has her business at her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from the communal bank Nueva Esperanza II, she bought products like chickens and ducks and food to feed them.
